review: stayed at this hotel for a week and definately recommend it if you plan to stay in mombasa, excellent facilities 5 swimming pools ! 1 with a waterslide which we had hours and hours of fun on, amazing to indian ocean from the room, very clean rooms , nets provided for protection from the odd mosquito that manages to sneak in to your room , staff kindly put out nets for you each evening and leave a bottles of water aswell as a mint sweet on your pillow (a lovely touch) , were half board and food was amazing with the variety of choices , definately hold back some room for the beautiful presented desserts , only realised have wonderful this hotel was when we had a flight delay and stayed at bamburi beach hotel which was down the road , for all travelers definately pay the extra
title: 5*  ?!?!  Maybe in the 80's
Lush tropical landscaping and great pools

review: Where do I start?? This was supposed to be the relaxing end of our African adventure where we were supposed to unwind and enjoy the comfort of a 5* hotel.  This is far from a 5* hotel.  Well actually the resort part of the hotel is nice but the rooms are 2* - 3* at best.  We were a family of 9 staying here in 4 rooms. We checked in after a long day of travelling, first impression as you walk in is great. But thats where it ended for us. As soon as we walked in to the room we were well and truly underwhelmed. Plain, clinical and not luxurious in the slightest. First of all we were supposed to have a double bed but instead had two single beds. I was willing to let this pass for the first night as we were tired and didn't want people faffing around changing things and letting
title: the hotel without a doubt made the holiday

review: Just had the most fabulous holiday in Mombasa............. Beach stay followed by Safari and return to beach for chill. Sarova Whitesands was the perfect choice for our beach relaxation.  Requested 2 interconnecting rooms which was not a problem. The rooms were very clean and towels etc changed frequently. The staff were so welcoming and pleasant, no request was too much of an issue and everyone was very polite and genuinely friendly.   A good choice of food which suited even the most fussiest 7 year old!! A choice of restaurants/bars to eat from......... no problems at all. The water sports included with all inclusive was a huge hit with my boys, even the extras such as jet skiing were reasonably priced and the staff were very helpful and patient.   All in all a definate 10 out
title: Sarova Whitesands.......... When can we return!!!!!

review: Stayed at this hotel after a 4 day safari in Nairobi with my husband.  The entrance is very grand and you get a glass of hibiscus juice on arrival.  When we were shown our room I was a bit disappointed as it was quite small and the bathroom was in need of some serious updating and repair, yellow tiles and light blue woodwork!  As it was my birthday we were upgraded to a bigger room which was a lot better in terms of size but the bathroom was just as tired looking.  The hotel makes an effort with the activities and there is something for all to do.  The weather was not all that good when we were there but then the world cup kept as entertained.  I agree with some people about the food, the all inclusive can after a few days get quite boring and one thing I did notice is that all
title: fantastic

review: The hotel from the outside and gardens looks quite nice...complex could do with a lick of paint but overall, the feeling in reception is a that it is a high quality hotel.  This faded however when we got to the room. The damp smell hits you as soon as you walk through the door. Mould is all over and the plaster is flaking off the walls. The bathroom was old and tired, the phone didn't work and the mosquito net was full of holes.  This was typical of many of the rooms in the hotel as we were part of a larg group all experiencing the same problems. I am told it is one of the better hotels in Mombasa, so I guess I could not expect better from this area.  One thing I will say is avoid the thieves on the beach outside the resort. They tout you for all kinds of crafts and souveniers,
title: In need of extensive modernization!

review: The rooms are much smaller than the website shows and are dirty and run down. Service is really slow and you have to ask for things several times. People leave towels on the sun loungers so it is impossible to find one that is free. If you are single and bring a guest back, the hotel charges you for the 2nd occupant which is a disgrace. Internet is slow and expensive. security during the day looks impressive but at night it is very slack. The hotel staff are clueless, i asked where i could get a burger and they directed me to a shopping mall, not one of their 3 locations in the hotel. All in all it was an expensive stay and i will never recommend it to anyone.
title: Beauty is only skin deep

review: Beautiful location, but the rooms are a dump!  The grounds and beach are impressive, but that is where the quality stops.  The rooms are old and not well kept; the air only works part of the time and you have to ask repeatedly if you want anything repaired.  Wifi is expensive but seems to work when it works, but then again, it does not always work...seems it will be fixed tomorrow! The people are friendly, but are not empowered to fix anything. They have a "quiet zone" but if you were not lucky enough to get a room on that side...sorry!   Food is abundant if like quantity...go here, if you like quality, you should look elsewhere.
title: Great location and facilities  - not top class though

review: We enjoyed our short stay at Whitesands.   The location, the gardens, the staff were all good.  We especially liked the wildlife in the water gardens between the rooms - the fish, the many colourful little birds and the resident heron that kept us entertained with his fishing exploits.   There were monkeys around but they did not bother us - but maybe those with rooms on the ground floor should be wary.  The rooms (especially the bathrooms) were starting to need refreshing.  Our room was close to the beach bar that had a night time Disco - great if you are into that.  But very noisy if you want to go to bed before the disco finishes!!  The food on the buffet could have been better.  We had tummy problems from the Masai Mara hotel and so were sensitive to yet another buffet
title: Wonderful relaxing stay at a fantastic hotel

review: I had the joy of staying here during the volcanic ash fiasco.I say joy...... All in the hotel was quite clean the rooms were dingy and need refuburshing. Staff on the whole were politeish but had a tendcy to do things in THERE own time. The food was ok but i had serious food poisioning throughtout my stay. The bar's and pool were chilled and relaxing with good kids club. The all inclusive was good value apart from the best drinks were not included. Now the GENERAL Hotel manager is a heartless opportunist animal. On hearing of our plight due to the volcanic eruption his first port of call in a crisis was to triple room prices and ask those people who some with young children to leave the hotel if they could not afford to pay he new rate. This was despite the fact that he was
title: A relaxing a eye opening experence that came at a high price!!!??

review: On arrival we were greeted with cold towels and fruit juice, which was welcome due to the extreme humidity. The suitcases were brought by porters straight away as they showed us the location of our room. The room had twin beds with mosquito nets around them, fridge, kettle,tea/coffee, large safe, hairdryer,air conditioning,tv and phone. The room and bathroom were clean but the bathroom had been badly redecorated and looked rather shabby with bright yellow paint stains running down the walls and the toilet and bath still looked dirty although they had been cleaned. We had a balcony overlooking the quiet pool. The hotel has great facilities -  swim up bar in the main pool, active pool with slides & diving boards, watersports hut, Cocos bar on the beach, air conditioned disco,
title: Good Hotel BUT The Rooms Need Urgent Refurbishment

review: We booked our holiday at the Whitesands Resort through Monarch on an all inclusive basis. The flight from Gatwick was ok but with hindsight i would probably have chosen a scheduled flight to Nairobi and then transfer to Mombasa which takes about 45 mins.  Anyway back to the holiday, check in was efficient enough and we were allocated our original room with no problem, however when we got to the room it was still been cleaned! We were subsequently taken to another room that had just been prepared. The first thing that we noticed was the dump smell but we did not think much about it at the time - maybe due to the excitement of been on holiday! However the next morning my wife woke up complaining of chest pains. We made a complaint to guest relations who said they would
title: A hotel for all reasons – and all seasons

review: Stayed there for 5 nights in April and enjoyed the place to a certain extent. The management of the hotel should put some interest into renovation of this place s its started getting old.  Pros: •	Food is great and we enjoyed variety of food •	The whole  tropical atmosphere. •	The green and nature. •	Gym is not bad. •	Entertainment in the bar is not bad as well.  Cons:  •	I spend 90 minutes during checking in trying to find a sea view room for me, they gave me first non sea even I reserved for a sea view one. •	Employees is not well trained and lack professionalism, they seems to do their best but still a lot they need to be trained on. •	Rooms are not clean and need a lot of revamping. •	We spend as well more than 2 hours in order to restore the AC in the meetings room.
title: COuld be better

review: This is indeed the best hotel in Mombasa. Although a little far from town but its worth the drive.
title: A stay worth the pay

review: The hotel is a 30 min drive from the airport about a 15 min drive  from the center of the city. It has beautiful beach and a nice buzz through out the day.. Good food with a nice variety of cuisines to choose from and has a great sea side bar to unwind & a small evening market. The staff is pretty warm & friendly. The rooms are nice & clean thou the bathrooms look old.. The hotel is pretty spread out with a Spa and has a number of extra curricular activities like water sports, tennis, gym, pools etc to choose from.
title: Needs Major renovation!

review: Sarova whitesands is neant to be a jewel in teh crown of the North coast, but not any more. It prides itself as a five star last time i checked but it does not live up to its billing. this was perhaps the 12th visit i made to this establishment over the years and it seems to go downhill with each visit, the cost of stay however doesnt seem to go down at all. From the reception where i was kept waiting for 25mins despite having a confirmed reservation1 because their systems were down (sic!) to the rooms which are run down - peeling paint, threadbare towels, loose sockets ltd food variety to waitering service that leaves alot to be desired for the price i have paid, i dont think i will pay another visit unless i have heard that they have renovated the place, so for the time being
title: Not so refreshing African Hospitality!

review: I have stayed at many hotels at the Kenyan coast...infact my family owned one not so long ago. I can speak with a fairly good sense of authority about The Sarova Whitesands and say that it is easily one of the best Coastal Conferencing/Holiday destinations off the East African Coast. Reasons are simple: 1. Customer Service - Years of experience -  1ST CLASS!! It is obvious that their long experience is an advantage having been in the industry for ages. Some staff who started off in junior positions a while back are now managers (eg: The fantastic Julius at Front Office etc..). Staff seem to know what their hotel well and you can even ask a Gardener a random question about the hotel and they will either answer you or take the trouble to find someone who will. Kuods  2. Location -
title: Probably the best conferencing facility off the Kenyan Coast

review: We stayed here 4 nights and had a memorable time.  Only gripe is the quality of rooms. We first had standard rooms and they are downright crude and do not justify the remaining good points of the hotel in general. Our travel operator African Quest Safari  had us upgraded to superior rooms at no extra cost to us. Even the bathrooms in the superior rooms are of poor finish( custard yellow wall tiles, wall dampness, chipped bath tubs, dreary washbasin worktop, poorly finished wallskirtings, heavily painted white doors - all too simialr to a Blackpool bed and breakfast setting) It is about time Sarova spent some time and money in upgrading the rooms (to a tasteful decor) to bring out the best in this hotel. Bring in flatscreen TV's etc.  Food quality, variety and staff attendance
title: Absolutely Amazing, stunning place

review: From the arrival I knew it was going to be special, hot towels and nice drinks at reception.  The service was excellent and nothing was too much trouble.  The food was good and the amenities were amazing.  Loved it, loved it, loved it.  Would go back.  The view from my balcony wasn't half bad eiher - Indian ocean - Wow.
title: Highly recommended- an amazing holiday

review: i have been going to whitesands since my son who is now 6 was born! The food is great and caters for vegetarians and children!!! the kids club is full of amazing staff!! Since there are no steps and its a very child friendly layout my son can walk around and not get lost!!! the entertainment at night is a lot of fun! i would definetely recommend this hotel to any family who wants to go and relax in the sun!!! the spa is really nice with amaxing massages!!
title: the only hotel where i can relax and know that the kids are in good hands!

review: This hotel is typical of many such hotels in Kenya. The facade and marketing is '5 star' (their website calls it '5 star mombasa beach hotel' ).  Below the surface this is a rather badly run 3 establishment who charge 5 star rates.  A better option is to actually go and stay in a advertised 3 - 4 star establishment so you get the same service at a lower price !  check-in :  The check-in was extremely slow despite there being very few other guests checking in.   room :  I was given a room which smelt of paint and varnish.  Apart from this -- there were no chairs in the verandah -- the chair on the dressing table was broken -- the floor was dirty -- and the bathtub tray still had old soap and cosmetics left by the previous guest !   Regarding the paint smell -- someone had done a
title: low quality place, pretending to be high class

review: We were in Kenya for the Virgin Safari /  beach package 24th August to 4the September 2010 and were worried by a lot of negative feedback for this hotel.  We need not have worried! The place is fabulous!  Typical of this part of Africa in the present political times it is of the fenced off "guilded cage" variety, but you can walk out on the beach and on the main road safely, we did!  We were on the "all inclusive package" and from what we heard from others we had a great deal with no cost cutting for us. The food was first rate and with a satisfying variety. The rooms were VERY CLEAN and yes some were tired by 5star europe standards or Dubai, but this is Africa for goodness sake!  What made it was the huge staff team from the managers we met Ravi and Angela down to the man with
title: Great place to chill out and see Mombasa after a safari

review: We have just returned back to the UK from Whitesands in Mombassa.  The hotel was absolutely fantastic.   The room was adequate, although a little dated, but to be honest for the time you spend in your room, it hardly mattered.  Our cleaner Collins did a fabulouse job of keeping our room clean and tidy every day.  The food was great, although a little slow sometime.  But, hey, who cares when you are on holiday!!  Every single member of staff was friendly and incredibly helpful.  We also had three days away with Rhino Safaris who were also very good.  They picked us up punctually for every game drive and got us back to Whitesands promptly too.  I can honestly not fault Whitesands in anyway and would definitely go back.  I would like to say a special thank you to the guys in
title: An amazing and wonderful resort

review: While the natural surroundings are beautiful, this hotel is like an old movie star still trying to dine out on its good looks.  The service here is horrible, especially since it is billed as a luxury resort.  During three out of four meals, we had to literally seek out someone to get us drinks.  When we order a bottle of wine (overpriced by the way) it took 20 minutes for the waiter to bring it to the table and then another 10 minutes to find another waiter who knew how to open the bottle with a cork screw.  Also during check out , we had to wait nearly 25 minutes for someone to bring out bags.  The pool is very average.  Even though there were only about 10 people using the pool, I had to track someone down to get a towel.  And if you want to order a drink at the pool bar, you
title: wonderful whitesands!

review: Stayed at this hotel from 24th July-7th August & what can I say....... WONDERFUL. The staff are a credit to the hotel, nothing is too much trouble for them and will go out of their way to help, everyone speaks very good english. The only little gripe we had is that the food in the mail resturant wasn't up to much, but we mainly eat at the pizza/steakhouse which was lovley. The entertinment team were brilliant, lots of energy and very friendly. There wasn't much on in the evening but it didn't stop us from enjoying ourselfs. Would go back today!
title: Good Place, although 5 star it needs a little bit more polishing!

review: I stayed at the Sarova Whitesands for 4 days on recommendation of a friend, and I was not disappointed. From the hot towel and exotic drink at the reception to the nice food, the beautiful grounds and several swimming-pools, it was very enjoyable. My room had sea-view, with the usual set of toiletries, hair dryer, TV and fridge, and a big mosquito net and insect spray.There was an in-house bank also selling stamps, and a Barclays bank with ATM just 2 min. on foot away. There were watersport facilities and glas-bottom boats to go out to the reef (some seaweed on the beach at this time of the year), and there is a spa providing massages and relaxation therapies etc. The staff was very friendly and helpful, in the dining room as well as otherwise.  Especially Wamboi Mugo from the
title: Lovely hotel to relax by the sea

review: We just returned from a 6 night stay at the Whitesands resort in Mombasa. It is conveniently close to the airport (15-20mins approx). We had stayed in a ocean view room which had great views of the Indian ocean. The rooms can do with some updating but were sufficient, as we did not spend to much time there anyway.  There is a good choice of food at the Whitesands , even if you are all-inclusive.  If you like watersports, there is a area within the hotel where you can go. It might be worth checking next door at Travellers Beach Hotel , you may get watersports cheaper there , as you can negotiate on prices (as we did) Unfortunately  you will get hassled when you go to the beach by the beachboys.  Just tried to avoid eye contact or a polite NO – and they should back off. The best
title: A wonderful stay
nice place lovely staff be even better when improvements finished

review: I spent one week in Saova whitesands resort in Mombasa, it was just like a dream. The service was just excellent, the staff was smiling all the time, present and helpful. Staying in this hotel you almost do not need to go out except to visit the beautiful city of Mombasa. The hotels has different restaurants and bars so we could not get bored and the main restaurant offered a large variety of food thats do not forget vegetarians or people suffering from allergies or diabetes. The Spa is just a part of haven, the staff is just extremely polite professionel and respect hygiene. The hotels has many swiming pools appropriate for different public. I will never forget my stay in the Sarova Whitesands, i gor pampered like never. I will never forget the smiles and the warmness of the
title: Not a 5*, more like 4* star facilities and 3* rooms, slightly disappointed stay.

review: Very comfortable large hotel with lovely grounds. A great variety of very good food in the main restaurant (including themed nights). Excellent pool complex and a delightful spa. We enjoyed the snorkelling and beach (although you will be hassled by beach traders) Very friendly staff and a nice beach bar. Our room had a wonderful sea view. A great, relaxing end to our honeymoon
title: Flop out at a beautiful beachside report!

review: the good - the saff are very helpful (when its going smoothly) - rooms was always clean - animation team was excellent couldnt do enough for you. - snacks at 4pm at cocos bar was lovely - pancakes, tea, coffee etc... - soup was well worth a bash.  the bad - aircon sometines smelt like cigarette smoke needs cleaning - food was hit and miss (dont know how to cook steak to your spec, chicken under cooked, cheese on a salad was like eating plastic it was that hard) -security man took a photo for us then pested me for money! - water was dirty when having a shower - woman suck there teeth at you and roll there eyes if theres a negative quairy - not proffessional unless theres not a problem. - not part of the hotel but once on the beach you get swomped by the beach boys, honestly it
title: good but needs tension to detail in different areas

review: when we were planning to take safari and beach vaccation we were recomeded this hotel but when we saw the reviews in thrip advisor we were bit worried becasue it was showing hot and cold. our travel agent gave confidence  that we should take this hote on the beach.i have to say this we had one of the best vacction of our life.. we carried so much meemorable things. one of tfamily member had misplaced  his mobile when having drinks when we were searching for it whith out knowing where we had lost a waiter came up and asked if we were searching for anything we said yes a mobile he took us to a security and bingo there it was . we had to sign some paper . this really made us comfortable that this hotel cares about their security of the custimers and customers belongings.  each and
title: Amazing staff!! Fantastic resort!!

review: Reading the reviews when booking our holiday we were a bit concerned, after returing from a great holiday and reading them again  can understand them a  little more. Yes the rooms are a little dated, humidity problem with the damp but they have attended to it by painting over it but everything is clean and works well. After the first day and walking around the grounds everybody is very polite and greet you with jambo, the gardens, pool areas are never crowded plenty of sunbeds, you start to appreciate the finer details. We arrived at 09.30 and were given a sea view room (we booked a standard room) having traveled a lot not many hotels let you check in this early in the morning. The room was attended to twice daily with  clean towels if requested and plenty of water.The dining
title: longer you stay the better it gets

review: My wife and I spent a lot of money to do a safari/beach holiday to Kenya.  We booked through Thomas Cook Signature and got the best possible hotel in Mombasa.    On arrival the reception staff were very helpful and efficient, booking in was very quick.  After that we were taken to our room and unfortuantely our first disappointment I'm afraid.  When we entered our room there was an immediate smell of dampness which was probably from the air-con unit in the ceiling, the puddle on the floor below seemed a sure sign anyway.  From there the TV seemed to have been taken from Noah's Arc and you were not always guaranteed a picture.  Into the bathroom and there were mould stains up the wall that had been covered with a lick of paint but not even enough to cover it completely.  The only
title: Good hotel, nice overall

review: Very nice food amazing rooms and lovely staff although it was for me fairly big and crowded. However for families it is amazing and kenya is a wonderful place EXCELLENT
title: The worst hotel I've stayed at in years

review: We were initially worried about the reviews we read but having stayed there we are happy we decided to go. Great location, excellent staff, good food in fact we added on some pounds. |Staff go the extra mile to attend to you. The room was good with 30 free tv channle all movies and live sports. No hotel in Europe offers that. We were on all inclusive and we really enjoyed ourselves my two little kids did not want to depart. The hotels grounds were well maintained and management team were always visible with a duty manager 24/7.  We will highly recommned this resort to all our friends go discover this gem in Kenya.
title: Fantastic Resort

review: we had wonderful experience of Kenya safari and beach holiday.. our thanks to white sands hotel. even though rooms were old their service and staff were excellent. all our requests  were met with only yes and they went out of the way to satisfy us at all times. the lawns were nice . cocos was awesome. it was really unique. weather was nice. all the staff went out of the way to make sure that we were happy. the rooms are old and tried and some of the cushions need to be changed . what they lacked in physical they made it up in their service and friendliness.   keep up the spirit.
title: Memorable Kenya and Whitesands

review: Well I stayed at the Sarvova White Sands. The white sand is covered with sea weed. The hotel needs to be downgraded to a two star property. When I checked in being indians we were shoved into rooms in one corner of the property which had abundent mosquitios. When I called the front desk regarding the pathetic rooms and got no response for 1hour . I called back and fired them on this . I was then shown a room on the third floor with no lift. When I protested that I had parents who were senior citizens and my father was a heart patient . I got one room on the ground floor  and one on the first. Did not mind since it was mosquito free. In one triple room we had one towel with no shower curton. This came at 10pm at night before we fell asleep. I did inform the supervisor on the
title: HORRIBLE HOTEL

review: We had been travelling around Kenya for 2 weeks and thought that we might splash out a bit and end with a bit of luxury by booking this hotel.  Travelling with 3 kids means that we have to book 2 rooms so it was a big deal for us to choose this place.  We shouldn't have bothered.  It is essentially a conference facility hotel and those on a conference are clearly a more important revenue source.   On arrival we tried to check in (2 hours after we were officially allowed to) but were told to go away as the rooms weren't ready - none of the warm welcome and cold towels and drinks that someone else had talked about.  The rooms had a great view but the bathrooms were shabby and no better than at a backpackers.  Both bathrooms were missing shower curtains.  The air conditioning in
title: good stay in coast of kenya

review: I was a little dubious after reading some of the other reviews on here but I don't think they could be more wrong. We had the most amazing honeymoon at the Whitesands, the staff were incredibly helpful and couldn't do enough for you and the location, right on the beach with pools and spa, was idylic. The food in the main restaurant and the bistro restaurant were excellent catering for me - a veggie and my husband who is willing to try anything. I cannot recommend it highly enough. Also a great location to go off on safari, which we did, you should definitely do that if you go here as it was amazing!
title: Fantastic honeymoon hotel with amazing staff

review: On seeing the entrance and the hotel I had my first WOW! moment. From the security guard to the receptionist and the bell boys all had a lovely welcoming look on their faces. The common area is beautiful and huge..the have different styles of seating some in the open air some inside the hotel. There are some gazebos outside which are absolutely charming and comfortable.   I had booked into a palm room and the view outside was simply beautiful..palm trees, the pool and the beach all views from my balcony. The room was not too spacious but was ok, clean and well maintained looked absolutely new. The bathroom was neatly kept too. The housekeeping did a great job each time replacing our bath amenities and replacing the cookies in the cookie jar.  we had breakfast , lunch and dinner
title: Beautiful Luxury Resort!!

review: Nice hotel but it is a bit dated.  Definitely needs some maintenance to come to the modern age.  The bathrooms especially need a major makeover.  We were upgraded from standard to sea facing rooms which was very nice.  But the shower head fell on my wife's head on the first day.  The bathroom door was rotting on the bottom end.  The fittings were chipped in a number of places and there was just a general need for a facelift.  The water went off one day, the hot water went off on another.  All was resotred within a few hours however.  Other than that, it is a nice resort hotel with everything one can ask for.  Nice spa, great pools and good food most of the time.  To have a 300 shilling delivery charge just to have food in your room was ridiculous.  And wifi really should be free
title: A honeymon and birthday experience to treasure for a lifetime!

review: We travelled with Virgin Holidays to Mombasa via Nairobi as part of a package holiday. It was my husband's birthday, they gave us a free upgrade, Slightly noisy entertainment some nights but this was muted once the air-con was running. Excellent sized room with mosquito net ( no mosquitos seen at all throughout our stay as it was dry season) and insect spray and plug in repellent provided. Bath and Shower. Spotlessly clean. Toiletries and hairdryer provided - plugs the same as in England so don't need adaptors,and good safe.  Beach towels at the poolside. 5 freeform swimming pools, our favourite was the one by the spa, no children allowed! The spa was excellent, had two wonderful massages, especially the one by Linda. Hawkers on the beach selling trips and souvenirs at vastly
title: Lovely hotel on the beach

review: This hotel is overpriced for what you get. DON'T BE FOOLED BY THE WEBSITE!  The grounds are nice and beach is beautiful. But that's were it ends.  Unfortunately, the rooms are run down and the food isn't very good at all. The pictures of the room were obviously taken a long time ago. The food was like that served in a work canteen.   We paid for half board but ended up going out every night. Yes, I know this is Africa etc. But I have travelled the world and stayed in much cheaper, more remote places where the food and rooms have better  at much lower price.
title: A LOVELY FAMILY HOLIDAY AT WHITESANDS

review: We returned from our Beach/Safari holiday on the 7th September.  We are a family of four with two teenage girls. When arriving at the hotel we were welcomed by the reception staff and from Angela who is on the management team, we were taken to our rooms which overlooked the sea both room were kept spotlessly clean at all times. The Food in the main Restaurant is on a two week theme for your main evening meal you could'nt fault this food at all. At breakfast time you had so much to choose from, cereal, fruit, fruit juices, egg/omlette bar.  At lunch time you had two restaurants to choose from which were both to high standards. Every afternoon you could go to the beach bar and have afternoon tea.  The entertainment team work hard at all times keeping the guests entertained during
title: NEEDS TO IMPROVE

review: I recently stayed at  Sarova Whitesands with my 2 young children &  family. We went there for my sisters wedding. On arrival we could not have wished for a nicer welcome. The hotel is immaculate & the staff are absolutely incredible! They can not do enough for you & ALWAYS with a smile. There is such a relaxing, friendly, warm atmosphere. The grounds are stunning. We each had beach view rooms. My room was quite far away from my childrens Grandparents so we asked if there was a possibility of moving closer.. This was done immediately with no fuss at all.  My sister, Mum & I met with the wedding co ordinater Wamboi & Innocent & what a delight, they was lovely & such fun. Wamboi talked us through the whole wedding plan & noted every detail. On the day of the wedding I was stunned
title: Stunning!

review: Booked hotel in advance prior to arrival, organised transfers to and from airport within the price, arrived and we had a bus waiting at the airport to take us to the hotel. So far so good!  Arrived at the Hotel at around 11:45 on 14/02/2011. Valentine’s Day!   Waited in reception till 13:00 as our sea view room was not ready. The lady in reception apologises and says she will increase our check out time when we leave to 11am as a gesture of goodwill as it was taking too long!    My Sony PSP went missing while all this was happening.  Complained to Security who intuComplained to Security who intern came to our rooms (we had 2 rooms as there were 4 of us) and made me open my bag take all content out of the bag so that they could check that it was actually missing. This was for
title: 4/5 STAR - No Way - More like 2 Star and thats being Nice!!

review: When our daughter and then future son in law hit us with < we would like to get married in Kenya> my wife and I nearly went into shock, thats halfway around the world we said and all of those innoculations and malaria tablets, why not have it in our local village church. Well can I say we are certainly glad they could not be persuaded. There were 9 in our party inc 2 young grandchildren and we all had the time of our lives. The wedding was fantastic and went without a hitch thanks to Wombui, Innocent and their  team, The chefs in the Pavillion were so friendly and obliging,all of the waiting staff in all restaurants and bars so accomodating, gardeners, security guards, Stephen from the African village shop and of course Hussein and all of his team who were great with our
title: 3-Star accommodation in a 5-Star location

review: Location is great and the grounds (23 acres!) are well kept, but the hotel itself is VERY old and not well maintained.  Do not expect too much and you'll do fine.  The shower, the air conditioner, the TV, the bathroom, everything is very dated and lacks proper maintenance.    The Mombasa area beaches are very nice and the Whitesands has lots to offer in terms of water sports and other activities, but I would seriously look for a more recently constructed hotel or holiday apartment.
title: Great staff,shame about the beach

review: We stayed at the Whitesands for 7 nights in Feb 11  with our 4 year old boy and can truely say we all had a great time.  The hotel was beautiful with lovely gardens. The food was delicious, we were on half board but both the Breakfast and Dinner was excellent with plenty of choices and different themes every night, from African and Arabian to English dinners. As the buffet areas in many hotels get busy and congested with diners, kids are offered  early free dinners in the Minazi resturant which is smaller & quieter and offered foods that they enjoy like fish & chips etc., The Major plus point for this Hotel was the Superb Kids Club, My boy thourghly enjoyed it, he was always looking forward to going and came back with smiles. It allowed us to have a relaxing break. So special
title: The service and warmth of the staff is excellent

review: Our 2 week stay at the Sarova Whitesands with friends was the best holiday we have ever had.  The service, warmth and friendliness from all of the staff was absolutely fantastic.  They all had a genuine desire and aim to make our stay as enjoyable and relaxing as they could. The hotel is ran very well with an abundance of staff all eager to help - they even sweep the beach and hotel grounds every morning. There are too many excellent staff to mention but special thanks to Moses the Pavilion chef, Hussein,David and the entertainment team, Francis -with the catapult, Millicent the grill chef, and all the staff at Cocos beach bar. The 11/2 day safari through Cosmos and led by our guide Alfonso(Alfie) was an exceptional experience culminating in a Lion/Zebra stalemate at the final
title: wonderful relaxing holiday

review: Only thing that could make this hotel better would be if the rooms were updated a little, especially the bathrooms. Excellent service, not sure why others have opposed this!
title: Excellent hotel and service!

review: I vacationed at Whitesands in Mombasa last week and I have to say I was very impressed by the spectacular level of service from all the Staff.  I’ve vacationed in Europe and other destinations but nothing beats the hospitality at Whitesands.    Kudos to all the staff at Whitesands and see you next time I’m in Kenya !
title: Excellent service!!

review: This is a nice hotel, and even a better stay.  I've stayed at this facility a number of times in the last 2 months and look forward to returning.  The grounds and pools are nice.  The rooms are clean and comfortable, but in need of updating.  The half board buffets are always a treat.  The pool bar and tiki bar are favorites of mine and all of my colleagues.  I highly recommend a snorkel trip, and take a walk down the beach to Juls for pizza and ice-cream.   Our only complaint is the beach.  Great beach, great water, but be prepared to be hassled from the locals attempting to sell you their good.  "NO" does not mean "NO" to these people.  We find we get best results when we completely ignore them.  This is one of our favorite stays in Africa, and we look forward to returning.
title: Great stay

review: I booked Whitesands after an excellent spa weekend at Sarova London. It's a shame the Mombasa branch doesn't live up to the company's good name. I had a bad experience at Sarova Salt Lick which makes me question whether to book with Sarova again.  Landed in Mombasa and went to Sarova Whitesands hotel. Hotel took one hour to find us a room despite knowing all European visitors arrive on morning flights.  The food at Whitesands was equally shocking; all meat and fish items were burnt and underseasoned. All the curries tasted of tomato. Service was exceptionally slow - we were only asked for our drink orders whilst halfway through our main courses.  On our second day, it took six phone calls to room service for complimentary mineral water which should have been supplied in the
title: Five star building, no star service
Misleading-Clearly NOT a five star- but is a THREE star!!!

review: Where do i start. The room was clean and spacious.Bed large and comfortable. The staff were very friendly and always greeted you with a smile and Jambo.                        The entertainment team were good fun and always had time to chat. DJ Kay at Oceans beach bar was always happy to play any request. We were invited to two cocktail partys where we met Mudassir (guest relations) He asked if everything was ok. Said that he was there to make sure the guest were happy. I don't think i've ever been in a hotel where the staff were so keen to please.                                                                                  The food was excellant. There was no shortage of sunbeds and places to sit in the shade. The only down side was the staff at Oceans bar. They weren't as
title: My best holiday ever
Lovely hotel in an idyllic setting

review: We stayed at the Sarova Whitesands following a week's safari.I was a bit nervous about it as there have been several bad review.However we found the hotel to be lovely in a perfect setting.We were not in a seaview room so requested a change and this was organised very efficiently. The restaurant was fabulous,the choices were vast and the hygiene standards were extremely high.For breakfast we liked sitting outside and the staff always arranged this.We also swam early in the sea and when we returned to our loungers they had always had a mattress and towels arranged nicely. The food in the cafe's was also to a good standard.We did not find the drink prices higher than our safari lodge except for wine which was expensive. We had a fabulous stay and highly recommend it,our only
title: Good points and bad points

review: The hotel from the front looks very impressive, but the rooms are dated and we found that the sliding door to the pool are didn't quite fit correctly in the frame hence allowing mosquitoes to easily enter the room. Most of the staff very friendly but we did have an unnecessarily long wait when checking in as one member of staff appeared to take a dislike to us.  (We had an inadequate 'apology' email from the member of staff concerned) The food was variable in quality, some food very good (we liked the asian food selection) and some very bad (even I can make an edible tiramisu) The same was the case with the evening entertainment which was good one night then bad the next. Whilst we were there the hotel appeared to be mostly filled with conference goers.  The pools were good (and
title: Our honeymoon was made unforgettable!!

review: We have enjoyed ourselves so much, this holiday has been so memorable and the hotel is amazing. The facilities at white sands are brilliant and the staff are really welcoming especially Stephen, both David's and Hussain. These people deserve to be noticed because they have been very friendly and made our family feel so welcome, we are very thankful! The food is delicious and the entertainment is brilliant! I have loved this experience.
title: Amazing Experience

review: The hotel and setting are excellent.  Mr. Hersi should be particularly proud of his staff and facilities.  Not wanting to miss anyone out I would like to make special mention of his brilliant chefs who provided a very wide range of wonderful cuisine, each meal was a real treat and the waiters were all very helpful and friendly.  The grounds are immaculate and the gardeners do a superb job.  The entertainment was very good each night and I should say you have a real ambassador for Sarova in Susan in Entertainments. So talented and friendly with such an infectious smile at all times. The Spa is first class and the swimming pools kept very clean. If anyone is considering going do not be put off if you are told there are renovations works going on. Believe me it is all so discreet
title: EXCEEDED ALL EXPECTATIONS

review: A very good hotel by all standards, the rooms tend to be a little small and sometimes need attention, but as a package this is the best. Good spa, good beach bar and buffet meaks are at best adequate. Lido on the beach is a special experience but very expensive, lots of watersports available. Overall the best experience and the safest option for conforence andf business traveller
title: Fantastic location....shame about the rooms

review: Just came back yesterday from a week at the Sarova Whitesands Hotel. Had a great time but strongly disagree with the 4/5Star rating that holiday companies give it. I would say it is a good three star pretending to be a five star hotel. i would give it a definate 5 Star for the service, friendliness and atmosphere.   However the rooms could have been a lot better. the rooms smelt of dampness, the decor was dated and paint peeling shows that there has been not much in the way of upkeep, where do i start with the bathroom, the shower was cold water, toilet leaking...maintainace had been called twice and the general state of the bathroom left much to be desired. The nets didnt seem to close properly and could explain all the bites and the tv quality was poor. if Sarova lavished a
title: A very relaxed week!

review: Stayed in Kenya for two weeks on safari and finished off in Mombasa.  Was looking forward to the trip and the Whitesands, which looked beautiful on the website.  I also had high expectations for Sarova since we stayed there in Lake Nakuru and is was very satisfying. However this hotel was a huge letdown. Upon check-in we were given a seaview room and were completely surprised by the condition of our room. We asked to be moved, but found the next room to be of the same quality. Here is a breakdown of the issues in the room: - The rooms are in dire need of renovations. The staff told me they are expected to be renovated sometime later this year (they should strongly consider doing it immediately). - The furnishings were sub-standard and not of 4-star quality. - The mosquito nets
title: Very average (2-star at best). Overpriced and rooms are VERY dated.  Not a great value.

review: ... the recommendations we received from Wamboi Mugo from Guest Relations. We visited her desk the evening we arrived and she arranged a tour of Old Town and Fort Jesus with a friendly, knowledgeable and safe driver, Suleiman, for the next day. We enjoyed our tour so much that we arranged a second tour through Wamboi. Her advice was helpful and perfect for what we were looking for - she listened to us rather than pushing a certain agenda. We happily signed up for another tour up the coast to Malindi and the Gede Ruins with Suleiman.  If you choose to stay at the Sarova Whitesands, definitely stop by the Guest Relations desk and ask for Wamboi!
title: Fantastic and definately a five star!

review: This hotel was great! They have thought of everything to make sure your stay is perfect! Gorgeous pools, chill out areas, totally relaxing 5 days and would recommend all inclusive as you get so much more than just food and drinks, including free diving lesson in pool and boat trip out to lagoon for snorkeling.  The service was beyond excellent. We actually timed the waiters when we put our 'flag' up for service and our every need was catered for in less than a minute!   The only down point is the hassle you get the minute you step onto the beach. Recommened sunset cruise up the creek in a dhow as an extra excursion.
title: Nice beach.... nice rooms... but too big for individual attention

review: I loved the White sands beach hotel, the rooms are beautiful: almost all have sea view, they have many pools and i especially enjoy the silent pool by the spa where i could read my book!  However, i found the hotel a little too big for individual attention. You are never a special customer in this circumstances and likely to be ignored. The dining had hundreds of guests, and service was delayed due to again, no special attention to an individual!  But all in all, i would go back to white sands again and again!  Highly recommended.
title: loved every thing

review: Pros Amazing grounds, great pools (one with a slides and diviing, good service, right on the beach, has water sports (cash only but affordable), camel rides on beach, good music at the bar, cocos beach bar is the best place to relax, swim up bar, Conference center was nice and they provided a pretty good lunch.  Cons Rooms were small and a lill dirty.  A queen is two twins pushed together. There were dead mosiqutos in my room  (better than alive and the room has a net) and the water was brown for the first few moments (but they provide bottled water) Buffet is average food at best.   Internet was spotty.  Notes: Pants required for dinner at the buffet Has a resturant (pizza and sandwhiches) open most of the day  You can sit on the hotel property and see the beach, but if you go
title: Amazing Grounds

review: A superb hotel right on the beach,ideal for relaxation and unwinding.The sea is lukewarm,,just like walking into a warm bath.Plenty of sun beds around the several swimming pools.We were aware of quite a few Russians,they seem to be the new Germans! Pool service was very good , if a little slow at times.DO take time to chat to the waiting staff,especially at the bars,we found them very friendly and helpful.The Spa is to be recommended,though not cheap Eg. massage at 5000/-.    Before booking All Inclusive,do the sums.Alcohol is restricted to the cheap local brands,in over 40 years of drinking,it is the first time a G&T has given me a headache!   The local Tusker beer is quite drinkable,but expensive,at 240/-, if you are not All Inc.( 90/- at  the local supermarket).    The
title: Nice grounds, limited choice of food, slow but friendly service
Beautiful grounds, great rooms and service and the ocean - wow!

review: Voyager Beach Hotel, just down the coast, set the standard last year on our first trip to Kenya. We were disappointed, therefore, when Whitesands fell so far short of our expectations, despite costing more money than Voyager, in the Virgin brochure. On the plus side the grounds are lovely, if a little lacking in open spaces. The pools are plentiful and well maintained. The sea view is fantastic and the beach is nice, but good luck fending off the beach boys (very common all along this coastline). The staff are friendly (we must have said "Jambo" 20 times a day) and do try to help. Our bedroom was reasonable (although the bed was too hard) and the TV had a good selection of (mainly) sport channels. The gym was quite good, but by no means the best we have seen (especially lacking
title: Best resort in Mombassa

review: I stayed at Whitesands with my boyfriend, sister and parents and had a fantastic time. After reading some of the reviews on here I was slightly worried as some are so bad, but I actually could not believe how much of an opposite the hotel was.  First of all, the staff are absolutely fantastic, they make you feel welcome and nothing is too much trouble and the service they provide you with is first class. The food was fantastic too, always hot and tasty, huge variety too, catering for all tastes (i'm quite a fussy eater), fantastic desserts!! And the minazi cafe is brilliant, fantastic service and food. The rooms were lovely, yes they need updating slightly but I know they have a big refurb planned, but our room was clean, cool and comfortable. Kenya is hardly the sort of place
title: Fantastic hotel, wonderful staff and service!

review: We travelled here for our wedding in February with 4 family members. Upon arrival which was in the early hours due to a delay the staff were incredible from start to finish. We stayed in a Palm room on an All Inclusive basis.  We were met at reception with cold towels and a refreshing drink. We were promptly checked in and shown to our rooms to get some much needed sleep.   From day 1 this hotel was perfect iin every single way.   The main reason for our stay was to get married, for this Wamboi and Innocent made the process very easy and relaxing. I am extremely greatful to them for the time they took and effort they put into making our day so special. I would also like to thank Fred for helping with the set up and flowers etc for our day, these were incredible even better than
title: great location and pools, rooms/ dinner menu  need update
Big Name BUT Not for the Value of your money

review: we stayed at Whitesands in February with our young child and had a great time. We had been before and chose it again specifically for the fantastic location on the beach and the ability to walk to some really nice beach front restaurants in the evenings and the fantastic swimming pool complex which is wonderful for kids. The staff were extremely responsive, eager to please and efficient.  The only things I would fault slightly is that  bedrooms and bathrooms  are a bit dated- remember this is 5 start africa not 5 star london, and the food which was ok, lots of choice at breakfast,  but dinner catered 50% to the african taste , lots of currys, which reduced the choices which were realistic especially for young children,. Having said this I would not hesitate to go back and to
title: Brilliant stay

review: This was my first trip to Mombasa and staying at a Sarova hotel.  The hotel is nicely designed and I had a lovely room facing the sea.  The room was adequate although I think the bathrooms need some major refurbishing.  I have spent a lot of time at beach resorts in Egypt and with the heat/wind/ect they are able to have cleaner, more updated bathroms.  This of course, is just a minor thing.  While the beach is beautiful is is sad that you can't really spend a lot of time right out on the water.  There are people who start to surround you to try and sell you items or ride a camel once you step off the hotel property onto the beach.  It's wonderful to walk along the beach in the evening, but again have to keep hawkers at bay.  I was there on a half board basis and I thought the
title: Nice Beach Vacation
Just as good (and bad) as everyone says

review: I holidayed alone here for 10 nights.  I chose Whitesands mainly for the Tulia Spa.  I read most of the reviews and can honestly say that everything good said about Whitesands is true – and everything bad said about Whitesands is also true.  Obviously different people want difference things from their holiday but for me, it was a mixed bag.  THE ROOMS – very good size, excellent sea views but they are a bit jaded and in need of freshening up. I’m sure when first built, this hotel was stunning.  The room was kept clean by the very friendly Samuel – the happiest man in Kenya! But he did overlook things; I was there 3 days before my bathroom dustbin was emptied and I did have to verbally request bottled water, nothing major. The air conditioning was also temperamental. THE STAFF –
title: The most enjoyable training conference ever!!

review: There really is not enough space for me to write an adequate review as I have many good things to say. I stayed at The Sarova Whitesands Beach Resort & Spa for 13 days as I headed up training conference for local creative entrepreneurs. I will summarise my experience to bullet points; - The customer service was beyond reproach. I loved the enthusiasm displayed by all the staff, be it the GM, the gardener, the security staff, the spa team, the sous chef, the housekeeping team, the swimming staff, the entertainment team, the conferencing team. They were all totally brilliant. Could not stress that any more. - The bedroom was both comfortable and scenic. The management were kind enough to upgrade me at no extra cost to a superior room due to my long stay and regular custom. This
title: Fantastic Holiday

review: We stay at whitesands at the very least 4 times in a year.    1. Kids club- The kids club is very active and our son loves it. Though I did hear one of the teachers  encouraging kids to name call their friends when they lost in a game and they called them ROTTEN EGGS over and over in swahili.(That was back in 2010)  2.Swimming pools are really nice though in High season you have to book your pool beds as early as possible  3.Rooms, we once stayed at the sea front rooms, but have since then insisted on the PALM Rooms, They are in better condition than the rest though they need to chnge the mosquito nets they are really old. NB:Some of the palm rooms are very small and go for the same price as the bigger ones. Insist on getting from 1115 upwards. The beginning ones (at least on
title: We stay here so often, its OK

review: Stayed three nights at this resort. Well put together, with traditional swahili coastal artwork, woodwork, dhows etc by the entry way. Open air dinner/lunch seating area. Check in flawless. Excellent wait and bell staff. Room was another study. Dated room with a 'smell' of mustiness (common in tropical climes). Furniture is European unsuited to Mombasa weather...85 degrees+100% humidity during the year. The bathroom was 'cleaned' but not much so. This area of housekeeping needs better attention but the price through mombasahotels.com was excellent.  The dinner and breakfast was buffet style with assigned tables....much like a cruise ship, BUT the cuisine was excellent..Indian, Swahili, Arab, African and seafood themes. Beach was rough as July tends to be (the colder season with
title: Big, bland, shabby, poor service
Amazing place we will be going back there

review: - Big, resort-style hotel, with little personality - Rooms very shabby and in need of renovation... - ... which seems to be in progress, as we were woken by loud drilling and banging every morning (despite complaining) - Very poor service, especially at reception. Staff listen to requests or complaints, nod, then disappear never to be seen again... - Food was mixed - the dryest checken you've ever tasted served next to the most moist, tasty fish tikka I've had!
title: loved it

review: A package hotel with beautiful & huge pool area, many restaurants on beach side & in main building. Since it was not a high season there was ample space everywhere, but I would imagine that the resort can accomodate even the full house quite nicely. The hotel is more than 30 years old, but it has been maintainted and updated to meet the normal tourist standards.
title: A good choice when holidaying on the South Coast, Mombasa

review: We had read the reviews of this hotel after booking, as I had visited the place many years before we had booked it on memory. The reviews were mixed and obviously worrying....... The location is fantastic, the staff are all lovely except a few of the beach bar staff who seemed a bit fed up. The A team - Lucy David and the crew are delightful.  Extensive buffets and the lido and Minazi restaurant all good. Not too sure whether the all inc is worth it or not as prices didnt appear bad any way.  Some reviews commented on shabby bathrooms, yes I would agree they are a little "tired" but spotless.  We were told by a senior member of staff on our last evening that a major refurb is in stages of progress and these would be rectified.  We will definately be back
title: Fabulous holiday

review: Just returned from a great 9 day stay with a friend at the Sarova Whitesands and having used this site to review the place before I left, wanted to give my thoughts.....Firstly - the negatives...as most of the reviews state, one of the negatives of the hotel is the standard of the rooms.  They are in desperate need of renovation and the hotel has plans to start this process in the next couple of months, so please don't expect 5* luxury accommodation.  The rooms could do with a thorough clean and the bathrooms updated but after raising the issue with our Kuoni rep, we were upgraded to an excellent standard of accommodation.  However, outside of the rooms, the resort is beautiful with plenty of swimming pools to lounge around and palm trees to relax under (although be careful on
title: Overall - a great holiday!!

review: Whitesands used to hold the top spot in this area but they have dropped to 4th behind Travellers.  I have stayed at 6 hotels and this hotel is not one of the best, don't get me wrong its Ok for the price you pay but its nothing exceptional.  Every Sunday they have an open day and its like a Lido and packed with people so a scamble for sunbeds etc etc and over run with children not supervised.  Food was good, staff very friendly but then most Kenyian's are.  I would not stay here again there are better hotels along the coast so please try other hotels and then you can compare.  Guest relations not very helpful our block had no hot water for showers most of the time we where there, we made do with cold showers and where told the rooms where in need of refurb and they were closing
title: NOT FOR ME

review: Service very friendly, and good. A bit slow sometimes, but the hotel was busy. Special staff mentions. Philip in Lido Restaurent, Halima in Busines Centre, Kenedy at the Pool. The rooms, we had a 2 bed suite were tired!! They need a good modern upgrading! The beds definitely need a change, like sleeping on a board! The amenities were goood, and we used the Gym often. There were many things going on and plenty to do if you wanted to be busy. We needed a quiet time so also good. Location excelent, the beach was beautiful. Near to Mombasa town, and also near to good restaurents outside. The best are the staff. Really friendly, and helpful. The worst are the beds!! Please change ASAP.
title: A Lovely Stay.

review: My family just returned from a 3 night weekend at the Whitesands.  We travelled with my 3 year old triplets and understandably were a bit anxious as we'd never travelled to Mombasa before.  From the minute we arrived at the airport and were so warmly greeted by Chicco until departure on Monday, we experienced exemplary service and hospitality.  Everyone we interacted with was only too happy to be of service and always greeted us with a smile.  The food was phenomenal and we all came back heavier than when we arrived!   We enjoyed the spa, went on a glass bottom boat trip and even took part in karaoke night.  Most of all, what I loved was the focus on children.  Mine enjoyed the nightly kid buffet with a fantastic array of healthy options, all the attention in the Ozone Play
title: For adult and kid fun, Whitesands is tops!

review: This was the second time we have stayed here in the last two years and have enjoyed each stay. The staff are very well trained and all of them give an excellent and very helpful service,nothing is too much of a problem as long as you are happy in fact they go out of their way to see that you are.There is some refurbishment going on at the moment to some of the sea view rooms but this was not a problem as there is not much noise in fact we sat out by the sea front a few times and did not notice it. Our room was very nice as was the one we had last year and it was well looked after by our room boy with some nice little touches and when we needed anything ti was seen to very quickly.The Pavilion Restaurant  serves excellent Breakfast,lunch and dinner with a huge choice to choose
title: A good weekend break
Fantastic service, food and public areas but rooms a bit dated.

review: Sarova Whitesands  is a perfect getaway. After a hectic schedule of safari when we reached Whitesands everything changed. We had a whale of a time. Our rooms were excellent,food is great. Good thing is every one in Sarova is smiling, a great deal of training it seems to me as myself a trainer. We enjoyed our trip to coral reef and snorkeling. Swimming pools and attached bar was excellent. We had good seafood. The restaurants and food are great. I had a very nice  hair trimming and coloring in the unisex salon. Every one is attentive and there is nothing we should be complaining. The hospitality was world class and I would assure that we will visit again. I had been to other hotels in Mombassa but the White sands is the best!
title: On e of my best holiday!

review: Arrived at White Sands after a fantastic week's safari but a dreadful hour and a half's early evening transfer from Mombasa airport in rush hour, to be warmly and efficiently welcomed by check-in staff, receiving, as throughout Kenya, a fragrant moist towel and chilled fruit juice. We were delighted with our upgrade Palm room which, like we were to discover of the remainder of the resort, was immaculately clean, and was cool from the ac being already on for our arrival. There were 2 bottles of water in the room, and 2 in the bathroom, replenished daily along with the tea and coffee making provisions. Thedre were also fruit and flowers. Bottled water was readily available throughout the day from all the bars and restaurants as part of the all inclusive programme. Unusually, 2
title: The best hotel in our world travels
A gem of a hotel sat upon a gem of a beach

review: I have been meaning to write this review for quite some time now but life got in the way. Myself and family have been on holiday to Kenya staying at Sarova Whitesands for the last 6 years. Every holiday taken staying in the hotel can be summed up in one word. Divine.  The hotel in my opinion cannot be faulted. The very first time I stayed at the hotel the first notion that struck me was the people. I have travelled to numerous countries across the world and although I have found people personable I have not felt as welcome as I did when I was in Kenya and still have not experinced that feeling anywhere.  There are no words to describe just how welcome you are made to feel. It is like going from home to home except that when you are there you can leave all your stresses behind.
title: perfect, altimate holiday destination at the kenyan coast
I would definitely not recommend this hotel for any businessman

review: As our family is now spread across the world a reunion in Kenya was greatly anticipated .It is no exaggeration to say that our week at Whitesands was a very strong highlight. A few of us have had the privelage of visiting the hotel throughout our childhood and teenage years and now as young adults and have therefore been able to form well rounded opinions on what the hotel offers.  Great improvements have definitely been made over the years and this was most notable in the food department and to such an extent that the traditional visit to the Tamarind ( Well renowned sea food restaurant) was forgone as the food on offer at the hotel was without exception varied, adventurous and tasty. Although none of us have special dietary requirements the fact that vegetarians are so well
title: Faultless Atmosphere
Great for the kids, excellent pools, good food but condition of rooms poor and bad service

review: We stayed at the Whitesands for a week with a baby and 2 kids (one an infant). The hotel is excellently located and on an active beach with always lots going on - camel rides, boating, swimming and lots of locals wanting to sell things.   We might stay again but probably not. The hotel has some good things going for it but also some bad things. First the good:  Good things: 1. The food is excellent. We were on half board and had great dinners and breakfasts each day. The dinners were lovely and we were especially treated to an amazing outdoor dinner with concert on easter sunday. It was lovely.  2. The pools. There are 4 pools but the kids pool with slide was hugely popular with our kids including the 1.5 year old as there is a beach like entrance into the pool so he could play
title: Look elsewhere for better value and service

review: I've just had endure another week at the Whitesands Hotel, Mombasa. I'm a regular visitor as it is my company's choice of hotel when I am in Mombasa on business.  It's fair to say I've had my fair share of weeks in this hotel and each time the experience seems to become less pleasant. I'll briefly describe (only some) of my areas of concern:  (1) In my opinion for a so called 5 star hotel it is (at best) in need of some major refurbishment. The rooms probably haven't seen a paintbrush for over 20 years, and the state of the bathrooms in my opinion would hardly merit a 1 or 2 star rating in the UK. The bedrooms are in desperate need of modernising/refurbishment in my view, and there often seems to be a damp/sewer type smell in a lot of the rooms indicative of  the air
title: Where I go to find myself.

review: My family and I spent a week at Sarova Whitesands, and had a wonderful experience. Despite being a large hotel, catering to all user types, the staff were extremely friendly and the hotel is designed around small intimate spaces that are as lively or as peaceful as you need. The rooms are spacious and well kept (presumably the recent refurbishment has eliminated those problems previously criticised), although I would recommend an upgrade to a Palm Room for the better views. The service in general was very good indeed, the staff very polite and attentive. The only criticism we had was that orders for drinks in the Pavilion Restaurant could occasionally take some time or get lost along the way. But this was a minor issue. Once our street dancing 10yo daughter latched onto the
title: Excellent family friendly hotel
A fantastic beach hotel with excellent customer service staff...

review: There is efficient airport transfer from the Moi International Airport for visitors arriving by air. The road links into Mombasa are good. There are a host of other sites and places to visit while staying this hotel.
title: Value for money

review: Excellent hotel,very hospitable staff,excellent meals. Can do better on cleanliness.bed linen not changedand towels appeared stained. Overal value for money,lovely hotel
title: Wonderful Trip and will certainely by back

review: The resort is absolutely beautiful with most rooms facing the beach.  The room we got was both near the swimming pool and just a direct walk to the beach.  The warmth and friendliness given by each and every member of the staff was absolutely amazing.  This makes the stay even more wonderful.  The food was great.  We were all vegetarians but the choice offered was unbelievable.  The choice of fruits and salads was great.  The beach was absolutely lovely and beautiful.  The whole surroundings for the hotel was great and the hospitality given was just out of this world.  We really enjoyed our stay and am already making plans for going again next year.  The only minus point was time was too short and would have loved to have a few more days.  Keep up with the wonderful standard and
title: Great Hotel !! Nice People

review: This was our first visit to Kenya and as we won the holiday in a competition we had not really researched the hotel as it was chosen for us. We were therefore a little apprehensive of what to expect. We arrived at the hotel and were greeted by the staff that were happy to take our luggage from the roof of the bus and take it into reception where we were given a towel scented with eucalyptus and a refreshing drink. Check in was quick and reasonably simple and we got our all inclusive wristbands and we then got shown to our room by the bellboy who explained as much as he could about what was in there and how it worked, he left without hanging about for a tip. After unpacking we went to explore our surroundings and were pleasantly surprised to find that the grounds were spacious,
title: Our first visit to Kenya, Sarova Whitesands good hotel
a perfect package to stay with family

review: its really awesome place to stay, beach sports,many swimming pools, everynight parties like karoake,salsa etc..nice food for even indian veg. spa.. you don't feel like going out of the resort.. it's though same like park hyatt in Goa. ohh forgot to say..hanve table tennis, clay tennis, dart game.. etc..and very friendly people.. JAMBO JAMBO..
title: Memorable and comfortable Holiday

review: I enjoyed stay in Mombasa at Sarova whitesands, the place is at a beautiful clean beach of Indian Ocean. The Hotel is well maintained with nicely done interiors for perfect holiday comfort. Good place to visit with family with variety of food, activities and above all comfortable stay. Service is bit slow but still recommended.
title: Good hotel, but not 5 star..beach no go area due to hassle...

review: Arrived with my wife on 22 July 2011. No problem at all with check in. Had to pay £60.00 at airport to get into country and also have to pay again to get out, so please note this when visiting Kenya. The rooms are what everyone says on this site, very in need of updating. Damp coming through walls and dirty bathwater. To be honest we liked this hotel as in Kenya it is a 5 star, but elsewhere in the world it would be a 3 star. That staff were brilliant and a special thank you to Ben Rodgers and the lovely Faith at seafood restaurant. The food is good and the service also very good. No real moans as went on a trip to a local village and the poverty is beyond belief. Took sweets for the children and they loved it. They live in mud huts and live from the land. Got a bit scary when
title: Absolutely Fantastic 10 Days

review: Hotel and facilities were fine as were the staff, BUT, the room we had was way below standard and in urgent need of upgrading.  Stained and chipped bath and sink, peeling paint, what was left of the paint that is, and generally scruffy. Pleasant enough stay but would not return.
title: Not as good as promised

review: what a relaxing retreat, i always use the spa on my trips to this hotel and it has been brilliant every time, i have had various treatments including manicures, massages and ear candling at such reasonable prices, all the staff are so attentive and are very good at there jobs jacob and lorna especaily!!  I will be returning again and would recommend to anyone staying at the hotel.  I would also like to mention how brilliant the entertainment team and gym staff are morris in the gym has got me all enthusiastic about my fitness, he took his time to show me a set routine which i am still working at and is great, they do classes albeit very early so i only made one but was pleased i went, the equipment is very up to date. I would like to say a big thankyou for your help.
title: tulia spa

review: Went to Whitesands this August after a week on safari around Kenya. AMAZING hotel, excellent service always with a smile. The staff are delightful nothing was ever too much trouble. The entertainment team are brilliant, they work so hard a true inspiration to me. The rooms are clean and tidy although they are dated this is in hand. The food was amazing what a choice everything you could ask for. We went all inclusive and it didnt disapoint. Would certainly recommend this hotel. already looking to book again for next year. Thank you to all the staff for making our week very special indeed.
title: This is the place to go for relaxing after a hectic safari

review: The hotel is is massive. Almost too big. The breakfast excellent. Location is good too.  The service far from good. Found ourselves being ignored by staff ofen. At the pool bar I saw the barman look at me then ignore me. Not until I shouted did he come to serve me. Unbelievable.   The bedrooms are in need of serious overhaul. Our bathroom stank. However the airconditioning was good as were the beds.  For the price its good value. Generally notice the service in Kenya to be woeful so wont hold it against them. Id go back.
title: Excellent hotel let down by rooms and service

review: Went to Kenya on 22nd August and back on 6th September with my Aunt, Uncle and 14year old cousin. Best holiday i have ever been on.  The hotel is fantastic and have the most friendliest staff. I have to give a big shout out to all the entertainment guys over there, they are so friendly and made our holiday(look out for Kennedy, the two David's, Simon, Anna and Rita).  The food is fabulous, they do a different themed night each night in the buffet restaurant. Good choice of food. They also have a seafood and italian restaurant. Service is a little slower here but this is to be expected as everything is cooked to order. But fabulous. You can also order from the non inclusive menu, which i would recommend for the seafood restaurant and trying the prawns (they are to die for).
title: What a holiday!!!

review: This by far must be one of the worst hotels I've been in. We arrived to find that on of the rooms wasn't ready to check in. As there was a large group, we required a few triple rooms.. Whitesands solution - a double room with an extra bed. Somehow 3 grown adults were unreasonable in finding the room too small.   After several conversations with the hotel staff one triple room was secured for that night, with the promise of a second one the following day after check out. With bags packed ready to move to a a larger room, we were advised nothing until 6 pm. Unable to actually plan our day, it was wasted waiting for the hotel to advise what we could or couldn't do.  After having wasted a day, we complained to the hotel management who politely informed us that they were fully booked
title: Never again
huge resort, great spa, right on the beach

review: This resort is massive - it has three different pools and is located right on the beach. Rooms are basic and clean, the beds have mosquito nets and there is wifi everywhere. The staff were super friendly, nice and helpful. It got a little boring always eating at the resort but, they have an endless supply of options for every meal with lots of variety and they really cared about if you enjoyed it- I was asked a few times how it could be improved. The spa is awesome and well-priced. Also, make sure you go snorkeling or diving- amazing!
title: Truly magical experience

review: After much deliberation we chose the Sarova Whitesands for our honeymoon base. We stayed the first night there and then spent three nights on safari in the Tsavo and Amboseli national parks.  The Sarova Whitesands did not disappoint. The staff were fantastic from the moment we arrived and could not of been more helpful. The Managers even take an active interest in meeting and chatting to the guests which is fantastic listening to any comments that the guests have to make and acting on them.  The pools are well presented and maintained and the hotel was beautifully presented at all times, even though they are refurbishing wings of the hotel this did not tarnish the exceptional attention to detail the staff have.  Highly recommended hotel and will definitely be visiting again. Its
title: what a wonderfully friendly hotel
A great place to chill out after a safari

review: After 8 days on safari we wanted to be able to do nothing but relax and enjoy the sunshine. This hotel certainly provided everything that we wanted. After reading some of the reviews we thought there might be some disappointment with the room or the refurbishment work going on but we have no complaints or negative comments about anything.  The bedroom was spacious and clean and had a great view, the bathroom was fine-could do with updating but this is in hand. The refurbishment work is so unobtrusive that you really don't notice it, it was only on our third day that we realised they were working on the two rooms below us. Food was excellent. Very varied and plentiful. The chefs were very interested in what we wanted and keen to answer questions about some of the foods that we
title: A great hotel

review: We stayed at the Sarova Whitesands for 12 days after a 4 day safari. I had had some concerns due to some reviews but they were all unfounded. The hotel reception was stunning, the staff couldn't do enough for us, the food was lovely, the buffet always had plenty of choise and the 'active grill was excellent', the Minazi's food was excellent, their Pizza's gorgeous and the Lido was very fabulous, although if you wanted seafood you had to pay for it with 20% off if you were all inclusive. The rooms were spacious and clean, possibly a bit dated but still lovely and they are refurbishing them at the moment. The pools were clean and there was plenty of them. There was plenty of entertainement ranging from kids club to diving. There was always excellent entertainement in Coco's bar in
title: Looks like Paradise from outside, but rooms spoil the picture

review: I was at the hotel for the conference for 6 days. It is great place for the events like that.  During the day you work, and at night you can have fun at the beach bar!  As many others already said it is nice from outside with 9 pools I think, a lot of palms and flowers, etc.  The ocean is close, but the guys there a bit annoying.
