I liked how all the restaurants and area around the reception is outside, so you do not find yourself stuck inside while you are working.  The service was ok for Africa, and the staff was very friendly, but slow.   Regarding rooms, I think that leaves much room for improvement.  I know that people say that this is good for Africa, but i did stayed in better rooms in Ethiopia actually.    One more thing, regarding food... The variety was good, and most
title: A luxury spot - by African standards

review: My daughter and I were guests at the Sarova White Sands Beach Hotel & Spa, in Bamburi, Kenya, right close to the Indian Ocean.  We were there this October while on vacation in Kenya.  The location is perfect, our room faced the Indian Ocean and we had a wonderful view of the beach and the beautiful ocean.  The hotel itself is quite gorgeous with it's Rhajastani decor.  This is a very busy property with conventions and meetings taking place while we were there.  The weather was hot and humid but we Californians didn't care about that too much.  We had wonderful air conditioning in our room and it was truly a blessing to be able to come in out of the heat.  Our room was very nicely appointed, complete with mosquito netting around our beds.  If there is a down side to this visit,
title: Almost Perfect
The good, the bad and the just plain ugly!

review: We arrived at the hotel after an amazing safari. We had been travelling on very bumpy roads for about 6 hours, so we were tired, sweaty and in need of a beer! First impression of hotel was “chaotic”. There were people milling about every where and coach loads pouring into the hotel. We got our keys at reception fairly quickly and were given a cold towel and a cool drink. The receptionist then pointed at a table and 2 chairs and said sit there….so we did! After about 10 mins I started to get impatient, someone finally came to put our all inclusive armbands on, when I asked why didn’t reception do that, she replied they don’t know how to! Finally we were taken to our room! It was bright and airy with a lovely view of the sea. The bathroom was dated, but clean, it’s been a long
title: great for kids

review: me and my 10 year old son just had 9 days in this wonderful hotel its          Heaven on Earth the room was lovely the food first class,and the staff excellent the water slide is great fun and my boy spent most of his time on it and in the kids club we had a wonderful time and are going back for a little longer next year
title: Busy but ok

review: Spent Holiday last Dec 2011 & /New year 2012.First Good impression of Hotel starts at the main gate bill board and well kept grass.Service at reception was quick and were in our room in 15minutes.Rooms are clean and bedding are changed daily and in some cases more if kids go to room from beach in middle of day and put sand on them and room floor. *Food is prepared quickly on request and it is worth it and tasty.Dinner has varieties of food,vegetables/fruits,red & white meat an sea food.Fact is that chef ,cooks and others have done good job to ensure all in 300 bed hotel are served and eat whatever is requested. *Kids section and games calendar is fine to keep them busy all day and away from parents or guardians. *As life style changes large numbers of locals and from neighboring
title: Hotel for Quiet and Superb Family Holiday

review: The hotel's exterior and public area (dining, pool, sitting) are very beautiful and well maintained. The buffet food was good and had a variety to chose from.  The room was however a disappointment. It was very basic and dated, we didnt unpack our clothes because the closet had a stale smell, the bathroom needs upgrade. The room has no decor, not even a single painting just a big frameless mirror. When we arrived there were no towels, it took the housekeeper 45min to bring towels.Our wakeup call was 30 minutes late. Iam very confused by the positive reviews, either some rooms are better than others or my expectation was high because we had just come from a 2 night stay at Mara Sarova Tent Camps in Masai Mara and the tent cabins were equisite, clean and a pleasant surprise.
title: Great place to stay after safari tour

review: We did not experience the checking in and out hassle that other reviews have written about.  There were a few others checking in when we arrived and we were taken over to comfortable chairs in the lobby area given a drink and sat there and waited about 15-20 minutes before the porters came over to take our luggage to our rooms. Yes the rooms are tired especially the bathrooms-however the bath and sink were clean and stain free.  The walls and doors needed refreshing.  I understand that a referb is happening so this issue should be eliminated shortly.   Great energy saving idea in the rooms-if the air con was on and the door was opened the air con would automatically go off-brilliant Tea and coffe making facilities in the room, electronic safe, fridge and complimentary bottles of
title: Fantastic home from home you will feel like one of the family

review: Exceptional !! from every aspect. Having had the experience of staying at the hotel in the 80's, 90's, 2005 and most recently in October 2011 with my young family, the hotel is still a favorite of mine when visiting Mombasa.  Due to the fact that we were traveling with two young kids (4 and 1.5) I contacted the hotel prior to my arrival to organize a ground floor room. From my first contact, the GM Mohammed and his staff were very professional and very accomodating to assist in the organization of the holiday.  Upon arrival at the hotel, we had a very warm welcome. We were simply asked to wait for a few minutes in the lounge and were welcomed by the Head of Reception on the day (Jayne). The reception staff organized the room and everything was prepared for our arrival. To our
title: Return Guest...(this time with family)
A repeat visit two years on

review: Having just returned from my third stay in six years at Whitesands, and having read my last review of Dec 2009 I relaise I need to add more detail. As previous visits, Whitesands is pretty good in most areas.. exceptions being the check in and check out procedures and room standards which are dropping.  The Hotel is showing its age now and the guest rooms in particular are in need of a refresh. At the prices the Sarova Group charge scruffy and tired bathrooms are not acceptable. I also stayed at the Baobab Hotel for a few days about 1km away, rooms are half the price and facilites more basic but the rooms not much different, however the food cany compete wit Whitesands.  Checking in and out procedures are very slow and the management need to pull thier socks up. It may be Africa
title: worn out
Great location, service a bit slow...

review: Just back from 10 day stay at Whitesands booked through Virgin Holidays had good and bad experiances will start with the good, the hotel staff were very good ,the food was very good the ground/pools great , dining areas/hotel lobby etc. great. now the bad ,the rooms were well past their best ,the first room we were given with a sea view (which we paid extra for)was terrible ,no net,patio doors that did not lock ,cupboard doors warped and would not close , paint and plaster peeling of the walls ,green mould in the corners ,dampness smell throughout the room. the only other bad point of the whole trip was the Virgin Rep. did not see him until the last day and then I had to have the hotel staff track him down as I had no way of contacting him for our departure details. once I did
title: Definately a nice honeymoon destination!

review: I woke up in the middle of the night by a noise, and found myself suffocating by ammonia filling up the room.  Gasping for air, eyes stinging, I struggled to get out of bed and thought there must be an attack of some sort.  I went outside and all was calm and I could start breathing again.  I could not go back to the room because of the toxic smell and lack of air.  I went to the reception in my pjs, asked for maintenance and was told they won't be available till the morning.  I insisted saying I cannot go back to the room, and got someone to come over with me.  He too, could not go into the room.  They told me to sleep somewhere else and come back in the morning.  I had an early meeting, so I asked whether it will be fixed by the morning, and they said no, they will start
title: DO NOT GO HERE!!! UNSAFE!!

review: Sarova Whitesands - a fabulous place to be. I spent a couple of days there with my family in mid October and I must say it is a hotel with a difference. Quite large I must say but personal, hands-on service with a smile regardless. Its the kind of place where you can have tonnes of fun as a family(especially for kids), test your adventurous side on the sea,sample various generous servings and cuisine, party at night and still experience total serenity or practice non conventional spa experiences if you opt for that. Being full of options you have the liberty of designing your own 'itinerary' due to the variety of experiences available.  A must visit for Mombasa!
title: 5 star,eerrrmmmmmmm?

review: Stayed at this hotel for 12 days,meet and greet was good,booking in ok,room(1054)looks on too the ocean(nice)bathroom needs updating(I noticed individual rooms being refurbished)food cafetieria style was reasonable,staff on the whole were very good(Esther and Ian wright(looks like Arsenal ex footballer)come to mind,Lido seafood was good,I had the lobster,who wouldn't ????but,it is not 5 star,other than that what can you say that other people have already said,oh yes I almost forgot,our beach vendors,oh hell I have forgot????
title: Very good

review: Stayed here on our honeymoon and again in 2009. Can't fault it. Great location and good staff and excellent food. Fresh food and never recycled. Rooms adequate and safety was not overlooked. Very happy memories indeed and would most certainly stay again without hesitation.
title: Beautiful Hotel, Rooms A Bit Dated

review: a fantastic welcome, reception area well presented and staff excellent in all areas of the hotel. we had a standard room with a view of the sea and gardens. room was fine but bathroom need some updating. we only had 1 night here before safari  but found the hotel well presented pool areas well laid out,beach bar on the evening had a nice atmosphere.it was our 25 wedding aniversary and we receive a basket of fruit and a bottle of wine this was a very nice touch. we would like to thyank staff for the hospitality.
title: rachael& mark 2011 whitesands

review: The staff and grounds at Sarova Whitesands were absolutely lovely but that is the best part of this hotel. We stayed here in September 2011 and it is more like a 2.5* than a 4*. The bathrooms probably haven't been touched in 30 years and although the hotel regularly cleaned the rooms it is virtually impossible to make a 30 year old bathroom look good or like you want to use it. The hotel is renovating the rooms and had done two when we were there - which when we poked our heads around the door had been done well and were more akin to a 4* - they just need to speed it up! Although the resturant staff try very hard the food is bland and tasteless and given that it is not advisable to leave the hotel there is little other option. Overall view - needs to improve in a big way!
title: Definately not 4*

review: From the moment you step out of the car and into the hotel is just magical!  We had a fantastic time my son and I and to quote him "I am enjoying so much it is sinful".  From the staff, the rooms and the visiti to Tulia was amazing!  I would love to thank management and staff for the hospitality according to us ane God willing we will go back again.
title: Abdulkhaliq & Mum Sarova Whitesands

review: The comnunial areas and hotel facilities were ok, nothing to shout about. The rooms on the other hand were a complete let down, they were in need of drastic modernisation, This has started and  two rooms have been finnished (out of 400 approx) We were told it was due to be completed by 2013. The staff are very helpfull and cant do enough for you, most have ulterior motive though and given the oppertunity will fleece you, watch your money. We couldnt fault the food at all, even if you decide to use the Lido and pay extra it is well worth it, If you have not been to Kenya before you will be pleasently supprised when you get your bill. My wife used the  tulia spar on numerouus occasions and was very pleased with the service and price. The gym, for those of you that train was well
title: IDS and Angi

review: Absolutely fantastic time at this hotel. There are several fantastic swimming pools from a silent one, children's and all in between. All exceptionally well maintained and in lovely settings. All staff at the hotel, from the gardeners, waiters, valets, receptionists etc.. were so friendly and helpful and couldn't do enough for you. They also all spoke excellent English. We booked through Kuoni and would recommend them, their representative at the hotel was superb. We had one of the newly updated rooms and it was beautifully decorated and furnished. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in the room. On our return from Safari we had an upgraded stay in the Presidential suite which was incredible and anyone wanting a bit of luxury, this would be the suite to book. It finished our holiday
title: Best time ever!
Great place to setup wedding in Africa

review: The Guest relations personnel is very good with setting up weddings. I would recommend anyone who wants to have a wedding in Africa to do it at the Sarova Whitesands. This place is great for couples to what to put fire back into there relationship. My wife and I stayed here on two occations Nov 2010 for 15 days and again in August 2011 to get married and to have a honeymoon for 21 days. thats right twenty-one days of doing nothing but entertains our self with each other...The Staff from Jana to Waboni is Great!! They service is excellent!!..We came from America to have this experence. From: Laurice Pamela Phillips.
title: Wonderful holiday - definitely recommended

review: We are a family of four with 2 teenage girls aged 15 and 16.  We stayed all inclusive for two weeks in a palm room at the whitesands and we had a wonderful time.  The hotel is not perfect - the setting, pools and grounds are great but the rooms are not luxurious and we found the beds a bit hard - however we've stayed in plenty of luxurious but impersonal hotels before and not had as good a holiday.  We went to the Maldives last year and had a wonderful time but enjoyed Kenya even more and what made our stay exta special were the people we met and the staff at the hotel. All of them are friendly and smiling and can't do enough to make you feel welcome.  I have never felt the need to write a review or name particular staff before so this is a first but some of the staff at
title: would get a 3.5 if one was possible!!

review: the hotel is dated, needs a refurb and room was dirty. food hall was vile, like a school canteen. worst bit about it was the carryings on with male guests and call girls in the resort and in the sea - not a family resort because of that
title: dated, dirty and not suitable for kids

review: I have been to the hotel twice and each time I always have a hard time reminding me that I wam there to work!!!the hotel staff are wonderful with special mention going to Moses who helps with the conferencing,terry at the reception who deal with my endless demands all with a smile on her face. The room service is also excellent as the staff are very friendly and are genuinly interested in your comfort, my room steward, MalukI became a freind during my stay. The restaurant(pavilion) also serves wonderful food and being from Kenya also it gave me a chance to experience different types of cuisine with a Kenyan twist. The gala night was superb!!!!as an organiser it was wonderful to see the delegates ooohing and aaahing over the decor and the food....Thank you all for a wonderful
title: Balancing work and leisure

review: This is my last night in this wonderful resort and i am so sad to leave.  The thing I will miss most is the fabulous staff, their warm friendly smiles, their helpfulness and their overall wonderful hospitality.  everyone (Wamboi a special mention!, Ann in the Dining Room, Anthony, and so many others) has made such an impression on me and i cannot wait to come back.  Everything about the Sarova is very special, wonderful food, fantastic location, fantastic range of facilities - unfortunately we were only here for a week which is far too short.  I will definately come back and would encourage everyone to come here.  its so worth a visit.  so come on!
title: must be better options in Mombassa

review: Check-in was ok although had to wait for the room to be ready. restaurant food is retro 1980 buffet with no seafood which is really wierd for a Mombasa beach resort.  The bizarre long trousers & collared shirts for dinner is also pretty odd for a family beach resort and quite out of keeping with the setting but fits in with their retro feel perhaps they should offer a five course table d hote menu too!  The beach is unpleasant, constantly accosted by vendors, can't use it as a family, the hotel don't seem to police it at all which as a beach holiday makes it totally pointless.  Breakfast was adequate but on two days the waiters that served us had obviously had a heavy night the night before both stank of booze.  Check-out was equally disappointing, after asking for my bill to be
title: Nice beach resort for all purposes!

review: We have family in Mombasa and have stayed at whitesands many times over the years.  If you are looking for a good quality hotel on the north coast then you can't go wrong.  What I love about this hotel is the staff who are excellent, the pool areas which are varied and great for families, the waterspouts club and the location.  The rooms can be hit and miss - the newer wing is great (we went last in June 2011).  In the past we have asked to move if we haven't liked the room and find the hotel amenable to this if they can.  Food is good but we tend eat out a lot - there are some great places to eat in Mombasa.  The beach bar is a really nice place to hang out.  There are some fabulous places to go out in Mombasa well located from the hotel.  Misono - japanese retaurant on a par
title: Lovely hotel on the north coast well located to make the most of your holiday to Mombasa
A well run and experienced tourist hotel.

review: A great hotel in a great location, the staff are efficient and friendly. Don't be intimidated to walk on the beach as many people are nervous of being hassled by beach traders. It is a beautiful walk out  onto the sand bar at low tide. Whitesands is a busy hotel but sun beds always seem to be available but pool towels are not, take your own as they run out very quickly. Many excellent restaurants are close by and often offer free transport, I have organised this through the hotel many times. The rooms are ok, a little dated but comfortable enough with good a/c.
title: Nice area, rooms need improvement

review: I have stayed there for 2 nights last week during my Kenya trip. Food is very good, swimming pools also, service at high level, people are kind and helpfull. Beach is average but ok, the only thing which I did not like at all (taking into consideration price)  are rooms!!!  Renovation is needed urgently!!!! Standard of rooms do not fit to all to hotel area - I suppose about 20 years ago were ok, now are weakness of the hotel.
title: Amazing Place, Amazing Staff & Amazing Holiday

review: Read a few reviews before we went and although slightly worried about the state of the rooms there was no problem. As long as you remember you are in Kenya then you will expect and have a great time. Anyway, all the rooms were being upgraded at the time of our stay (Feb 11th 2012 for 8 days)  Hotel itself was a good size with plenty of pools and great restaurants. The breakfast buffet and Evening Dinner buffet were out of this world, you couldn’t get better. Every evening was different and the food was superb, always fresh, hot and extremely tasty!  The other restaurants were also very good, these were situated by the beach and pools and the food was excellent. This is normally where you ate lunch as this you had to pay for, however, it wasn’t very expensive 950 shillings for a
title: Overpriced and rather shabby

review: I visited Whitesands after staying at the lovely Panafric in Nairobi and the standards are just as high. Whoever trains the staff should be commended. You feel so welcome. The room and the view was fantastic and myself and partner had a wonderful week and will definately return next year. Excellent food and entertainment. Top quality
title: Could not wish for anything more

review: having stayed in another hotel for two disappointing nyts, we decided to shift to sarova white sands. the staff was very friendly.. a refreshing change frm our previous stay! i wwas served with a smile always!  the food was amazin! :) the cooks with the live cookin were friendly and one of them even showed me how he made the fish wich was very yummy i went for 2nd helpings without feelin uneasy!:) the pool was our fave hang out durin the day! we enjoyed the slide as much as our 2 yr old!:)  the grill by the pool side has reasonably priced food tht tasted good! by the way the hotel has 5 pools so u really cant get bored of swimmin:) the beach is clean and well connected to the other hotels and theres a lot happenin on the beach frm volleyball to camel ridin or simply baskin in
title: AMAZING HOLIDAY
Relaxing and fun esp for children

review: We stayed at Sarova Whitesands in 2nd week December. The hotel was quite booked, and we were given room which was standard sea view facing. The rooms was allright with an excellent view.It overlooked the small garden and the sea was visible from the rooms. Though the room in itself was quite ok but the bathrooms were not what we expected.The bathrooms were clean but looked little old,perhaps this was the old wing,but nonetheless clean.There is a safe,tea andcoffee making faciltiesand cooking jar,ironing board and a welcome fruit platter.  The spa is very good. We opted for the couples massage and it was very relaxing.The spa I must say is wonderful,with reflexology pool,jaccuzi,plunge pool etc. The treatment are not very highly priced for massages.  The swimming pools are
title: Lazy management = slipping standards

review: Beach is wonderful and the lobby area is nice.  The rooms are really in need of renovation.  I would look for another hotel to stay in Mombasa if you can find better.  Wireless works but spotty.  Service is very good. Breakfast and Dinner buffet actually were quite good.
title: Badly in need of renovation!

review: We stayed at Sarova Whitesands 04-Feb-2012 to 12-Feb-2012 and had a lovely time. The food was just lovely - fresh pineapple and mango taste so good when fresh like this. The food wasn't aimed at a particular nationality and there was always something for everyone. Be adventurous and try anything that looks remotely appetising! Nuisances were.......having to sign for every single drink instead of being able to open a tab for the night and dear little Faith, the sales person for the Lido restaurant who pestered us day after day to order lobster - this became tiresome very quickly. The upsides were the surroundings, the willingness of the staff, the cleanliness of the pool, the monkeys running free around the grounds in the mornings, the spectacle of fresh coconuts being harvested
title: Just the best time!

review: As a trainer and corporate consultant (http://www.powertalks.biz/) i get to spend most of my time in hotels. I have observed that while some hotels have everything from 3D televisions in their rooms and have body temperature controlled rooms they may still lack the essential ingredients that differentiate a good hotel from a great hotel. A great hotel is all about service.  It’s the human face that accompanies the hotel. A great hotel makes me feel at home even when i am hundreds of miles away from home. A great hotel provides seamless service for my work while there without making it look like they are doing me a favour.  A great hotel must be able to provide me with a variety of choices for entertainment after a busy day. A great hotel must make me feel like family and not a
title: Had the best time!!!

review: As other reviewers have said this hotel has been around for a while and some of the rooms are in need of refurbishment but they are large and generally looked after well. I stayed in a superior room for part of the trip and they have been refurbished and a bit more modern. But on the upside the hotel is in a great location with fantastic grounds. Whilst it is true that the beach boys do annoy you when you go to the beach if you are polite and say no thanks they generally leave you alone. The entertainment team are fantastic no Butlins here just really nice young people who work hard to engage with the clients. The food is very good and a fantastic range. The beachbar is great with fantastic cocktails. The spa is fabulous and very reasonable. Like all resorts in Kenya check you
title: Best location on beach

review: Stayed here in December. The  7 rooms we got after waiting to check in for three hours had mould on the back of the bathroom doors and bathtubs were stained. The closet lights did not work and neither did the air condioting. They would only move us if we agreed to pay an upgrade charge although we had paid an upgrade charge for ocean front rooms. Service was very slow in the restaurant and housekeeping. Tried to speak to the G.M Mr -- but he never bothered to contact us after making a request four times to one of the other "Asst resort manager". On returning back when we did finally get in touch with the Mr -- his response was we should have looked up his number in the hotel directory. One would imagine if you asked a senior manager for the G.M that this would be sufficient
title: Dated Rooms

review: I was in Mombassa for work, so I didn't spend really any time enjoying the pools and activities.  For what it's worth, they looked nice.  However, the rooms are very dated.  I was initally given room 3065.  It smelled of paint, the aircon was weak, and the batteries were dead in the TV remote.  But, worst of all, on one side was the band from dinner (plays till 9:30pm) and on the other was the bar (goes late).  Ergo, there was no way I could have slept in that room.  I requested a move, and to the hotel's credit they did so without any trouble.  The only problem is that moving to the hotel's "quiet zone" required losing my sea view.  But, the night's sleep I got in room 2014 was good, so losing the view was worth it.
title: Don't expect a service if you book directly

review: I am a Mombasa resident, a trainer and usually do not sleep in Mombasa hotels when in  a seminar/training....except whitesands. Its clean, has good staff, great food, accessible, very secure, you will feel at home there.
title: I leave 3 km away, but I slep there!

review: My husband and I stayed here at the end of February for 10 nights, after an excellant stay at Mara Intrepids, this was our chill out part of the holiday. Our room was not great (but the hotel is under going refurbishment), and we spoke to our Virgin Rep, who with the help of the front desk and the customer relations, ladies, Rose and Innocence, we were upgraded to a suite. Nothing was too much trouble, the staff were superb, and so friendly with out being OTT. We stayed on an all inclusive basis, which we found great. The bars and restaurants were always clean, and the beach bar was very relaxing. Ladies, I would recommend a manicure, at about £5 for a 45min visit and french polished, I though it was very good value for money, as was the massage. Overall a brilliant end to our
title: Highly recommended

review: Stayed here in January and March 2012 and I must say I had a wonderful time. Staff were exceedingly hospitable and food was great. The swimming pool is outstanding and enjoyed having a dip. A walk on the beach is refreshing although you may encounter occasional hawkers who would try to sell wares to you. The rooms need to be refurbished and was glad to see that this is in process. Would definitely go back
title: A very relaxing stay

review: We spent five days here after our safari and it was very relaxing. Most of the people who appeared in the restaurant seemed to be business people and flight crews.  The hotel seemed fairly quiet proably due to the decrease in people taking holidays in Kenya.  It would appear that the hotel is undergoing refurbishment and one whole block was in the process of being revamped.  We stayed in one of the rooms which did need updating and although it was very clean the bathroom was extremely tired.    The food was very good and as much as you could possibly eat.  They clearly cater for all tastes and if you went away hungry then you would have a problem wherever you went.  The staff were all very friendly and helpful.
title: Not brilliant

review: We were picked up with the complimentary shuttle which was great.  Checkin was super slow - took us 20mins and there was literally only 1 family infront of us waiting in the queue.  Rooms seem recently rennovated and are very nice - apart from the toilet. Its yellow and the seat was all scratched. Shower gel, shampoo, conditioner was provided.Tv is a box tv not a flat screen.   On the plus side - food is excellent, swimming pools are amazing. Lawns are well groomed.  Service in the restaurant was poor wen it was busy.
title: Service is not 5star

review: Stayed there for 3 nights...  Rooms are terrible and in dire need of updating/maintanence...Also be very careful about where your room is - Beach front rooms are right next to the Coco Bar which plays very loud music till 1am most nights   Landed at Mombasa international airport and took the sarova shuttle service (which was brilliant) Got to the hotel and booked into one of the palm suites - room was very dull / and furniture quite dated... Bathroom was not very clean and could have done with some paint/maintenance ... Basically nothing like the pictures shown on their website...and definately not 4-5 star in terms of accomodation  We complained about the room and eventually (after one hour waiting in the lobby) they showed us one of the standard rooms which although smaller
title: Whitesands April 2012

review: we were there with my wife on jan 2012, we were received well and offered a complimentary habiscus drink which was very refreshing, the staff are very friendly and the rooms are clean. the animators are just wonderful and there was different shows every night. they even had a salsa night and we were taken thru some salsa lessons, it was fun. the buffet is great and full of different types of mouth watering foods. 0n the down side the water in the bathroom taps was brown but this was fixed after we alerted the management, otherwise this is a great hotel and i would recomend it anytime to anyone wishing to relax and enjoy. i will definately go back there in future.
title: World class services at the number One exotic,beautiful,relaxing hotel in Coast,Kenya!

review: I stayed at Whitesands for my anniversary weekend, and it ended up being the most romantic perfect moments in my life. When we arrived, we were welcomed by extremely friendly staff and a welcoming drink to welcome us to the hotel. The rooms at Whitesands are spacious and cosy and extremely classy! We had a bathtub in the washroom which had every ammenity that one would need, romantic lights which dim). ;) Rooms are sparkling clean and give you the feeling of being home away from home! The Food was delicious and buffets had a variety of world cusines. Our room overlooked the presidential pool which was calming and quiet, and provided me with that relaxing holiday I was looking for- Not forgeting Tulia Spa, which had the most friendly masseuse and loads of diff massage spa
title: Sarova is the No 1!

review: Spend the Easter weekend at Whitesands, this was very much a last minute idea, and no regrets at all, the room was fine not luxurious but comfortable beds. Great food and service in the restaurant. The Hotel is doing a major renovation to their sea view rooms, which should be done by Christmas. definately a place we would go back to.
title: An Easter break

review: Just came back from a vacation in Mombasa where I stayed a week at Sarova whitesands The room I stayed in was big, clean, comfortable and was just renovated.  The Food was excellent with a variety of choices everyday.  The hotel staff were very nice, helpful and are always there to make sure your stay is enjoyable. They have actually arranged all my tours  and a safari in Tsavo. Kudos to the great staff that make this hotel an enjoyable place and a world class hotel. keep up the excellent work.  Fardowsa
title: Lovely hotel and amazing staff

review: Lovely stay in October 2011.  Beautiful location and staff were very helpful and attentive.  Mohamed in the restaurant was particuarly helpful.  It was great to have a rest there after the safari.
title: Great hotel

review: My wife and I have just returned from a 3 week stay in Whitesands in March. The staff are very,very polite and helpful. The resort itself is right on the beachfront,there are other hotels along this stretch of beach,but by walking along the beach,you can clearly see,that the Whitesands is the best one available.The beach is magical. The Reception area is very well presented,staff welcome you with a cold towel and a fresh juice as soon as you arrive. Check in was swift and the luggage was carried to the room by the porter. The rooms are good by Kenyan standards,the hotel is currently going through a major refurbishment,but at no time do you hear any disruption. The rooms were very clean,we stayed in 2 different rooms,as we returned from a safari mid way through,and both were
title: Enjoyed every minute
Great for Kids, and parents too!

review: I was working in NBO in Dec, so we had a family vacation here for Xmas and New Years. Service is excellent, the only two things I would say the rooms definitely need updating. Get rid of the bath tubs and put in good showers. When really hot the dinning area is really humid. This means you do not enjoy your dinner whilst feeling really sweaty. Need fans or a/c in the dining area. The kids club is fantastic. Overal very good.
title: Good but over priced

review: This would be average if it were in Europe or USA I think , but have to remember where you are!  The public areas, grounds and pools are really good and well kept.  The large pools and slide are great to cool off in and for families and the quiet pool is relaxing.  Food and drink are well priced and usually pretty good, good selection at breakfast.  Staff are really friendly and helpful, very laid back though!  Rooms really could do with updating though, more than a lick of paint.  Pretty clean overall but just looking tired now, nice touch with the Doom insect spray, needed it a few times.  Love the cookies in the room too with tea and coffee.  Didn't have any towels in my room on check on it but maid was really kind and gave me extra.  Right on the beach here too, security
title: Great pool and grounds

review: Highlight of our trip to Kenya was meant to be our stay of 5 nights over Christmas in Mombasa at the Sarova Whitesands Resort.    When we go away on holiday we expect the rooms to be of a far superior quality to our own at home especially when paying premium prices in a resort.  What a total let down this was.  Shame on Sarova for pretending to offer us  5* accommodation.    We refused to accept the first room we were shown to and after a short wait were shown to one of their ‘best’ rooms and upgraded to sea front view.  Sadly the condition of room was still poor.  Bathroom was very dated; basin and toilet had peeling discoloured paint and door was in need to some paint.  Towels were poor quality and overall the room was dark and depressing.  As for the bedroom – the
title: Whitesands Mombasa
Great beach resort!! Excellent vegetarian food!!Rooms need attention

review: Stayed for two nights, very good buffets, excellent arrangements very good services. Overall it was very good experience. Rooms need to be renovated to rate it  five star.
title: loved the stay in whitesands

review: I had a two week stay at Whitesands breaking it up with a 3 day safari.  The staff were discretely attentive in particular in the main restaurant and around the quiet pool.  It wasn't 5 star in my past experience but was very clean and there were a variety of activities to participate in - spa, water sports, evening entertainment etc.  The hotel was very busy most of the time with confererences and a wedding.  I felt very safe and secure there with security on duty all the time.  I did take a walk along the beach but gave up after being hassled by the hawkers, even during the night!  The view out to sea was beautiful, though, despite the second week being very rainy - I would recommend this hotel and would revisit if I was in the area.
title: Fabulous hotel

review: we stayed at whitesand hotel for few days, the pools are great the restaurant food is perfect . the enviroment is homely. for the couples planning for wedding, the place is perfect there are so many places to take the pictures but let me brief you about the package and my experience. the wedding was arranged very well by the co ordinator just to let you know for the pictures is only 24 to be precise but the package dont state, the sparkling breakfast is not what you expect it better to go in the main restaurant and have variety since you just order in the room but nothing special about it. special turndown wasnt done only returning the mosquito net that it.after the wedding i requested the remaining wedding cake to be delivered in my room but it wasnt. we had an internary so we
title: GOOD BUT HICUPS
long oberdue renovations are taking place

review: at the moment the long overdue renovations are taking place.  The food standard has improved, the service needs still to be improved.  Great very huge swimming pools....
title: Go for the day pass, don't stay the night

review: Good hotel - Above average. My first option is Serena but when that is not available this is a good back up. Service is good, the rooms are decent (could do with an upgrade) and clean and the breakfast is yummy. If you are looking for a nice, quiet break this is not necessarily the place as the staff always trying to get you do some activity. But the cocktails are good and with a group of friends you would have a good time.
title: If Serena Beach & Spa is fully booked stay here

review: For a "5 Star " Hotel White sands facilities, particularly the rooms, were very shabby. I stayed in this hotel 10 years ago & at the time it lived up to its rating & price tag. It looks like the classic case of not maintaining facilities until they are so run down that wholesale renovations are needed. Thankfully renovations are in progress but for a big chain like Sarova to let this hotel fall into such a state of neglect is shameful. The bathtubs, cupboards & sinks were stained a dirty brown, furniture in the room was worn & I found massive holes in the Mosquito net. The only beautiful part of the hotel in my view was the lounge/bar area at the reception. The white beach was great but the experience of taking a stroll was spoilt by due to constantly being being accosted by
title: Slipping Standards

review: The day before flying from Nairobi to Mombasa I was listening to a guest speaker (US Ambassador to Kenya) who said the difference between good and great is this much - using his thumb and index finger to show a small amount.  I could not help but think of that during my time at Whitesands as while it is a good hotel; it is not great.  This is my families' third time to the coast with the previous two times at the Southern coast of Diani where the hotels were outstanding.  Most hotels know you have one chance at a first impression which is where Whitesands did poorly.  We arrived late afternoon 3 hours behind schedule due to a Kenya Airways delay and heavy traffic from the airport and our room was not ready and no indication how long it would be so were asked to sit and wait.  I
title: A treasure you should bag
First time at Whitesands, it won't be the last

review: After staying in other Sarova chain hotels on our trip I was at first a bit disappointed with Whitesands as the room we stayed in was very dated.  The pros - the food was great loved the fact each day they had specialised chefs at breakfast cooking something different - Indian pancake - yum.  The location of different pools made it easy if you wanted to get away from the crowds.  All the staff were very friendly and the location of this resort right on the beach was great. And lastly the massage in the day spa was fantastic.  So would love to go back when the rooms have been upgraded.
title: Will like to go back once rooms are upgraded.

review: Waiters in dining halls were nice and fun - but often, they forgot to bring the drinks we ordered. Generally, we waited a long time to get any drink or food we ordered.   Food was very good and plentiful.Lots of different types of food! Great buffets.  Great beach. NICE pools-  a bunch of different ones. Good activities.  Pretty resort.   My experience at the reception area was poor:: The room we were given was being re-painted and was filled with drop cloths etc - and they didn't even apologize at reception. (And I was NICE about it.)  When I was given a new room I was told "This will do".  I spent time in about 5-6 rooms - about half of them smelled mouldy. Mine was recently repainted, but you could tell they had painted over the mould.   Seemed like the place was too big for
title: Not coming back
Good resort, rooms could use an upgrade

review: Overall this is a really good resort.  We went with a group of 8 family members to relax on the Kenyan coast.  The stretch of beach adjacent to the hotel is beautiful.  The pool was very clean and the common areas are very comfortable.  The food is excellent and there are numerous vegetarian options.  The cakes and tea at tea-time are delicious and a nice touch.  The spa is quite relaxing - try spending a few hours on the hammocks nearby as it is very quiet and a great place to nap or read.  The rooms however are in need of an upgrade - it seemed quite old and in need of some attention.
title: Excellent all round Resort

review: after our safari experience we were booked here for 4 nights and we had a blast on each if them. There are lots of activities for kids and I must specially mention Mary of Ozone Kids club who took special care of our kids. The food as usual of all Sarova Hotels is well spread and amazing, catering to all. The night entertainment was also good, with acrobats, bollywood night, the dance on Jhoom barabar Jhoom was even better than the actual film. The spa is also located facing the beach and was a wonderful and soothing experience. Not to mention the pool with the slide for kids. Its a huge property and well managed and catered to. Would love to come again and again.
title: Well on the way to get my 5th star when the new rooms are ready

review: If you're looking for some quiet time and your prime goal is to relax in a peaceful location, I WON'T recommend this place BUT if you're looking for a place where you can rejuvenate, have tons of fun, do multiple activities and party like a rock star then this is the place to be at. I went here with my wife and 2 friends, and we stayed for 4 days but there was not even a single moment where we felt bored or out of ideas to do something. In every nook and corner, there is something or the other activity happening. The staff is very helpful and courteous. There r 4 swimming pools, if m not wrong and all cater to different set of people. There is a kids pool, an activity pool, a relax pool. The gym is very organized and well equipped. There was a prayer room for Muslims which I
title: Massive and exciting
Amazing Honeymoon Experience at Sarova White Sands

review: My wife and I had a wonderful honeymoon experience at Sarova White Sands Beach Hotel & Spa. The beach is so lovely and there are lots of activities to keep you going. We particularly enjoyed the Water Sports (Jet Skiing), Boat Cruises and a tour of Mombasa Town guided by the professional hotel taxi operators. With five (5) swimming pools one is spoilt for choice. The food is so amazing and the hotel staff are so hospitable. Can you imagine even the General Manager came around and greeted us and even gave us a complimentary beach side dinner!!! We couldnt have chosen a better honeymoon destination, it was indeed a memorable experience.
title: Awesome but can still improve

review: It was fantastic get away from work...good food, decor and pools and beaches. the rooms need to be improved.
title: MISSING MY CAMERA FROM THE ROOM

review: My name is Isabel from Riara high school and very recently we had a school trip to Mombasa organised by Lindberg Tours where we were staying at the exotic Whitesands hotel (room no.2004).The experience was amazing until the afternoon before our departure when my roommates and I left our (undone)room to have an enjoyable afternoon at the beach having left my camera at the dressing table charging.On return a few hours later,the room was well done but my camera was missing.Interestingly the camera pouch was present but empty.I reported the matter to the security hoping they would enquire from the room steward immediately only later to inform me that the room steward had left.By the time we were leaving the following morning,the matter had not been addressed with the seriousness
title: Absolutely First Class

review: This is our 4th holiday at Whitesands so that says it all!! As many reviews say, the rooms are in need of refurbishment but a programme is underway.  The staff at this hotel are a gem.  They are efficient, friendly and professional.  Nothing is too much trouble from the reception area (Yvonne is  brilliant) to the pool (check out the excellent Justus) to the room attendant (Felicitus was so good) to the beach bar (Peter will look after you) and the restaurant staff are equally good - too many to name. The grounds of the hotel are first class and the beach provides interestting walks in both directions.  The pools are clean and well maintained and we failed to spot a single piece of litter during the 2 weeks we were there.  Try a local bus ride (Matatu) great fun and so cheap.  A
title: yet another great holiday

review: This is one of the best resort properties in Africa and the world.  The location and scenery is a  tropical paradise that you will  fall in love with right away.  It is located right on the shores of the Indian Ocean with palm and coconut tress dotted all over the place.  What a sight it was to behold the sun rising from under the sea with its simmering orange glow. The staff are so professional, friendly and courteous. The is a prime place to relax and take in nature at its finest.  The food in this resort will thrill and soothe the most discriminating palate.  Seafood, meat lovers, vegetarian etc. there is food for everyone fresh and tastefully  made to order.
title: You cant get it better!

review: A fantastic place, We have been going there for many years and it has now become our annual local vacation hotel. The food and people are far beyond my expectations! Every family with young babies and children must stay there. They take excellent care! I think when the refurbishment is complete the rooms will be even better.
title: worst hotel ever

review: Im from the netherlands and my wife is kenyan.after a long drive from the maasai mara we went to the hotel to see if they had any rooms available.my wife went to the reception to ask if there were rooms as i waited in the car with the kids.the receptionists ignored her and attended to the white guests first despite the fact that she was there before them.finally after around 20 minutes of waiting Lillian one of the receptionists attended to her.she asked if there were rooms and Lillian just gave a plain NO and turned to another guest.She came back to the car and i decided to go ask myself.Lillian attended to me very fast and said they had rooms and asked what kind of room i wanted.I called my wife and on seeing her Lillian was veeery embarrased since she had told my wife there
title: Thank you for your exceptional hospitality!!

review: although it was a business trip, but the choice was excellent, even spending the entire 10 day stay in the hotel was not as boring as one would expect, nice staff, great service, amazing beaches ...simple loved it and would do it again soon hopefully
title: amazing

review: Cold-hearted staff who lack respect or consideration for guest. Be sure to get all terms in writing or they will make you pay more. Rooms smelled bad.
title: Not worth the hype

review: Great place with 5 interconnected pools including a beach type pool with slide for the kids, we just wallowed in the water for a week, couldn't ask for more, the rooms were spacious, airconditioned with fans etc. most rooms face the tropical gardens bordering the beach, A dive and water sports centre are also on the property. the hotel is easy taxi ride into Mombasa and not far from the airport plus a wildlife sanctuary more or less accross the road.   The restaurant area is great and so is the food, dispite it's large mass market beach resort size it has plenty of space to feel quiet and peaceful.   Just look it up on the internet and believe the photos.  Popular with Kenyan and Tansanian expat residents
title: Chill chill chill!

review: I had the privilege of being accomodated in this resort during my travels across Kenya. At first i was a bit apprehensive when my tour operator Mzima Safaris, www.mzimasafaris.com recommended it outside the general itinerary  for the Kenya in style safari on their website. But my apprehension was soon turned into delight with the amazing service offered at the hotel and the exquisite touch of their rooms with an Africal decor. Thankyou Brian for going out of your way to make my safari such a wonderful experience for such a price.
title: These guys know luxury

review: Recently spent 5 nights at this hotel - the building is quite impressive, but needs a little updating in the bedrooms and bathrooms. The staff were friendly, but not always in evidence when in the lounge area whe we wanted to order drinks. The food is aimed at the Indian clientele rather than westerners - this was a disappointment as we did not want curries every day.  This variety of food could be improved on. We had booked a twin room, but were initially given a double bedded room, this was changed to a twin room, but we were not happy as it was on the ground floor.  So we asked to change again and were allocated a pool view room on the third floor.
title: Great hotel - but room for improvement

review: I stayed at this resort on business for 3 days from 20th August.  I have to say the staff were very attentive and helpful.  The food selection in the restaurants was good.  The accommodation was in need of some work.  The floor of my room was very dirty and dusty and the water in the bath/shower was dirty.  The room I had on the ground floor was very noisy as I had footfall on both sides of the room.
title: Lots of work needed

review: We visited this hotel for 5 nights in July 2012. It came with a high reputation and price tag. On our arrival we were very unhappy with the welcome and quality of service that was shown to us. There was no porter in attendance and when one was found we were overlooked and not even shown to our room on his return, we were again overlooked. When we eventually did get to our room we were very disappointed and we immediately made our opinion known. Admittedly the hotel was under renovation during our time there but nevertheless it was dirty and clearly not up to the standard we expect from a hotel of this stature. We voiced our dissatisfaction for the next 24 hours and even considered moving hotels but eventually a lad at reception called Godwin who has excellent customer service
title: In need of upgrading

review: If you don't  mind cockroaches, lizards, and spiders in your room then you might consider this hotel. The hotel is absolutely disgusting and zero quality for money. on my first night I found 2 spiders and a cockroach on my mosquito net, the hotel changed me into a room that is even more gross, it had a disgusting old bathroom that hadn't been refurbished in like 10 years, with a sink that is full of scratches , peeling (please check my photos) and a wadrobe that hadn't been cleaned since god knows when. I'm not exactly sure how it rates as a five star hotels, I wouldn't even rate it as a 2 star hotel!!!! what's even worse is that the staff found my complaint wierd!! If you're looking for a clean place to stay , look some where else, this is not the place to go!!!
title: A good hotel

review: We stayed at this hotel at the begging of August for 7 nights, with a see front view room on an all-inclusive board. I would rate this hotel 3.3 point.  The rooms are lovely, large and have all you need in there, including a fridge (empty), to keep your water (or other drinks) cool. There is an on-going refurbishment, so I don’t know if we stayed in a newly refurbished room or an old one, but most of the furniture and electronics require urgent replacement. We had a small old TV which was not very comfortable to watch from the bed. If you choose for a see front view, you have to prepare yourself for a noisy atmosphere all day and all night (we had to call the reception to do something about the music from the bar at 02 AM in the morning, so that we can get at least few hours of
title: #1 for kids!

review: My daughter and I have just returned from a 5 night stay at Whitesands and we couldn’t fault the accommodation, there were renovations going on but these didn’t affect us at all and hardly even noticed them.  I stayed here 2 years ago and the friendliness and service of the staff in all areas was again exceptional, special thanks go to Susan, Joseph and Geoffrey who waited on us most days.  The food was excellent and so many choices - we tried 3 restaurants and all delivered great food and service.   The grounds and swimming pools were fantastic and so clean.  Our only disappointment was the evening entertainment at Cocoa’s beach bar - when I came before the animation team was led by Francis the Entertainment Supervisor, who was amazing at his job, but unfortunately he had left
title: Excellent Hotel

review: Hotel is dated. Staff at the pizza place are really not interested. A lovely location, clearly let down by poor management. The check in team were great, however, beyond the ornate reception, nothing at all has been updated since the day this place was built. Rusted fitting, rooms which really arent clean by any standards, and actually very little privacy in your own room.  Free wifi! whoopdidoo. strange why more guests arent using it to write more real world experiences about this lacklustre performer. Reading other reviews, i am a bit concerned as to the disparity, and also considering that some of the negatives were written quite close to some of the glowing reviews.  I am thinking that it may be that some units have been refurbished and they just havent got to the rest as
title: Once Again A Refreshing African Hospitality

review: As a family of five, we departed from Heathrow to Kenya, Mombasa on Sunday 19th August 2012. The duration of the holiday was 3weeks, which included the Safari of 5days at both Tsavo “East and West National Park”. The holiday package was booked through “Virgin Holidays”. We flew with Kenya Airways from London to Nairobi and then transferred in a smaller aircraft to Mombasa. The service of Kenya Airways was excellent and will not hesitate to use them again. The Virgin rep, "Juma Zuberi" at Sarova Whitesands had given us first-class advice to benefit from the holiday thoroughly.  The food at the hotel was absolutely superb, with a variety of choices such as Indian, Italian, Thai and authentic Swahili food. We enjoyed eating and drinking fresh fruit daily as the likes of Mango,
title: nice

review: Visited Sep 2011, sorry for late review. Great Place, friendly and helpful Staff and Management, Good food (specially if you are Indian vegetarian). Brief nightly entertainment (can do better), Going on beach was much hastkle from local vendors! so remained mainly in Hotel Compound. Rooms were old but spacious and bright, hopefully now Sep 12, it must have been refurbrished, will visit again soon. Keep up the good work.
title: Sarova Whitesands

review: This is excellent service with an African touch. The service was exceptional and everyone was very pleasant (except for a hostess and receptionist who we think were having a bad day on our first night). Food was good, with a nice selection of cold salads and unparalleled selection of fresh juices. We had a standard room which was quiet and sufficiently large. Their huge pool was great for laps, and their cookies at tea were delicious. They have an excellently equipped gym, suprisingly much better than Serena Hotel. Their long ocean front ensured that we had a front-row seat every day to the beach.   There was ongoing renovation on their seafront rooms, and we appreciated their candor about it from the time we began our booking.   The icing on the cake would be if they would have
title: Excellent holiday!!

review: Stayed here for 5 nights after a safari with family. Excellent staff, in particular Wamboi in Guest Relations and Yvonne and Julius at reception. The food was stunning, good variety and catered to all tastes.   Rooms were good, clean and spacious and lots of choices of sun beds/ pools and bars during the day. Activities organised were very good as was the entertainment. Would thoroughly recommend for any family holidays - caters for all age ranges!
title: Mombasa in general is overrated...

review: I was not impressed as we got into Mombasa and then with our initial experience with Sarova Whitesands.  We had to switch rooms and there seemed to be a lot of confusion with the renovation.  If you're going to renovate with guests on the property, you need to know what you're doing.  The hotel ottherwise is beautiful but the service was spotty at times.  It looked like they were handling a lot of complaints from the guests.
title: Amazing 5*

review: We stayed as a family of 4 for 9 days, with a safari in the middle. We enjoyed the stay very much, once we settled into the hotel routine. Re food, our teenage children loved the buffet, I personally enjoyed the restaurant on the beachfront. We were able to choose from a varied all inclusive menu, which included the fresh fish of the day ( each one was lovely), steak, pasta and vegetarian options. The meals were relaxing, so lovely to sit beachside, watching the beach activity. We were very pleasantly surprised by the quality of the wine, enjoyed a Pimms while watching Andy Murray in the Wimbledon final!  We made use of the tennis courts, rackets and balls were ok, glad we didn't worry about bringing ours from home. The activities and entertainments were good, particularly the
title: All inclusive Sarova Whitesands

review: The Whitesands did not disappoint at all. the staff were very kind, check in was warm and excellent. I got a nice room, not overlooking the ocean but with nice palm trees and a swimming pool. the pools were clean. with 337 rooms, it was quite quiet and peaceful. the waiters were mature (some old) but very efficient. Food variety and quality was excellent. The seminar facility was also always well set and manned throughout. I definitely will return.
title: Beatiful location with well kept grounds

review: We stayed 5 nights and enjoyed the varied food choices with different themes. The staff is Excellent and very helpful. This is the third Savora hotel we stayed at during our 2 week holiday in Kenya and loved each one of them.
title: Lovely Beach Location!!

review: My family and I stayed 2 nights at the resort and the view was excellent.   This resort is right on the beach so it made easy excess to the water.  The grounds were pretty, the rooms were spacious, the staff very friendly, the food was a little disappointing....there was a wide selection, however it was not tasty.  When time we were there, there was a group of high school kids and three weddings going on so it was really loud, noisy, the high schoolers were totally out of control.
title: Great Location!

review: I was on a weekend treat for my birthday and wasn't it amazing. From the concierge to the reception to the waiters....Amazing people!.  The meals are rich in variety and i fell in love with the swahili breakfast.  I can't put so much blame on the old rooms because already the issue is being addressed with the on going renovations.  Convenience to the malls is supper and i cant get enough of the Tulia Spa.  Well done!! I would definitely stay here again.
title: Amazing Staff Attitude.

review: We stayed at this hotel in company with 2 other couples from our party, as a 5-night extension to an absolutely sensational 7-night safari holiday in Tsavo East National Park (reviewed separately).  Our experiences couldn't have been more different for the two parts of the holiday.  It is a very big hotel and currently, there is extensive (and much needed) refurbishment work fo the rooms going on.  Whilst we fully recognise that this is essential as the décor in the rooms was badly in need of it,  we did not expect to be spending a holiday in the midst of a building site with its attendant level of dust (which even encroached on the dining area), noise (starting at 7 a.m.); and general inconvenience.   On arrival, our tour guide had arranged for us to retain our rooms until 4.30
title: A great disappointment after a wonderful 7 days on safari

review: We stayed here with Virgin Holidays. We were promised a brand new, refurbished room by Virgin (even in writing). However, when we arrived we were told that they were not ready yet! The hotel staff were very helpful and apologetic but we were obviously disappointed. Our room was a let down and if a hotel is refurbishing rooms, then there is an obvious reason - because they need it! Ours really did - but it was clean etc so we put it behind us and enjoyed the resort. The resort is lovely- beautiful pools, great food in the restaurants, and lots of activities to do - the staff attitude and service was exception'al - they couldn't do enough for us. This made up for the poor rooms. We had a complimentary massage in the spa, a good-will gesture lobster dinner in the seafood
title: We're still here !

review: i must say i was impressed by the service i got from when i arrived the receptionwas great ! Though i got there early they got me a room with no extra charges for me and my 2 gals they have a greaaaaaaaatpool and poool bar nicefood oooooh n the site is to die for so im saving to go back again thanx white sands
title: Best holiday

review: The facilities in the hotel are excellent. The food was the best we had throughout our safari and there was a very large selection for each meal in the main restaurant, plus two other restaurants to choose from on the site. There are four pools to choose from depending on your mood, two of which look out onto the Indian Ocean. The rooms were well kept and air conditioned but the bathroom could do with a bit of a spruce (clean, but quite worn). Service was very friendly throughout all of the bars and restaurants. The only negative point about the resort (nothing to do with the hotel, mind) is that you couldn't go on the beach without immediately being confronted with numerous people trying to sell you their trinkets or tours. They're very persistent and don't take no for an
title: Great facilities and excellent food

review: My husband and I and our four teenage children returned yesterday from an amazing holiday at Sarova Whitesands. The hotel sits right on the beach in beautiful grounds which are very well kept. From the moment we arrived we were treated like royalty, staff could not do enough for us. Everyone from the cleaners to the general managers greeted us with a smile and a 'jambo' or a 'karibu' whenever we saw them throughout the day. Our rooms were kept spotlessly clean and we liked the personal touch of the card telling us who our room steward would be.Views from the ocean front rooms were great looking out over the lido pool surrounded by palm trees and out over the Indian ocean. As for the food, there is a wide selection to choose from in the Pavilion restaurant, but our favourite was
title: Great holiday

review: We stayed here for the second week of honeymoon after a weeks safari and were looking for a relaxing week following a week of early starts and that's definitely what we got. We had already been made aware of the renovation work going on so we weren't surprised to see the building work going on when we arrived, we stayed in the block right next to the one currently being renovated and it didn't bother us at all. We were lucky enough to stay in one of the new rooms and they are definitely worth the work being done, all completely modernised with full entertainment centre and rainforest shower. Its definitely worth requesting a sea view room and paying the extra to get one of these new rooms. We had a late flight and so on our last day got a different room assigned to us so we
title: A great finish to our honeymoon

review: There are extensive building works going on that seem likely to last for some time. The noise during the day is just about tolerable, but it extends into the evening, so if peace and quiet is on your agenda, avoid this place until it is finished.
title: SHOCK WITH FTI AGENT AT WHITESANDS

review: I was  in Sarova Whitesand Mombasa for 2 weeks. Most of the workers were very friendly and greeted almost every guest with Jambo and how was your day?. We had a family room facing Indian ocean.A wonderful view everyday. It was spaciuos for us 4 as we spend most of our time at the pool with the kids. Service was very good. Even after our air-conditioner broke down, after reporting it was repaired within a short while. The rooms are being repaired and this we knew and this did not interfere with the hotel routine. Food was marvelous breakfast and especially dinner.  But FTI AGENT was a catasatrophy.We will never ever travel with FTI again. My family learnt a lesson which they will never forget. We were invited for a drink at the reception through a card thrown under the door.
title: Honeymoon

review: Having just returned from a weeks stay at Whitesands I was a bit weary that the refurb works would spoil what would be a quiet and relaxed holiday. Upon our arrival we checked in, the lobby is no different from other hotels ive stayed in, i dont spend much time in hotel lobbies prefering the pool etc so its design was immaterial.   The room - at check in, we were told that us virgin customers would be the very first people to stay in the new rooms. The hotel is very proud of them and i must say i am too. Smart card entry systems where you wave your key on the door and it opens, a modern light and spacious room, flatacreen tvs, entertainment hubs with all hdmi and usb slots on the wall, speakers in the bathroom which was very modern, nightlights, new beds which were lovely. All
title: Put up with the work, the end product is worth it!
Huge property with lots of standard facilities

review: Our experience at the property was overall average. It has a standard lobby. The overall property though huge, and with all kinds of facilities  like multiple large pools, water sports, bar, evening entertainment, shopping, the work, the quality of everything, the, maintenance was average. The room was large but the decor was nothing special. All the restaurants served decent hygienic  food. The buffet had large variety, but was just ok in taste. The service was average. So all in all an average place!  If after doing the Masai Mara, you want to round out you vacation with some time on the beech, look elsewhere.
title: Dated Hotel

review: Stayed here recently for an exhibition. Was in the Palm Rooms. Being the most expensive, they have no ocean views, but views over the swimming pool.   The rooms are a decent size, and have a nice bed with duvet and decent pillows. The bathroom is OLD, and the water is yellow. The bathroom needs major renovation. There is a room safe that works. The cupboards need renovating as well. The TV does not have enough channels. WiFi if free, and works very well. We were using the staff log in.  The restaurant is massive. The food average. The deserts all taste the same. The fruit is always unripe. Service is like a school cafe. Lots of noise, and very friendly when they want you to complete a survey. They do try, but the food lets them down.  The conference facilities are average and
title: Wonderful facilities. Local traders in and around the hotel don't make it as relaxing as it could be

review: I visited the Hotel in October an we were in a group.It is a beautiful and cool place to be in. We were well received and generally had a wonderful time there.The rooms are good although there was some renovation going on while we were there but the services we received eclipsed that little inconvenience.The rooms are nice and clean and any concern raised with the Housekeeping team is expeditiously attended to. Staff at White sands have very good PR and at no time did i encounter a grumpy one.Another great area within the Resort is the well tended and beautiful grounds,so green and so many palm trees from which one can seek refuge under to escape the hot sun!The food there is the best,there is so much to choose from and the different theme nights make it the more interesting.Not
title: ''RELAXING PLACE TO BE IN''
Second Time better than the First

review: Having read some of the recent reviews on here, I’m wondering if I visited the same hotel!!  Due to our last holiday at Whitesands being so incredible, we booked here again for October.  I have to say the work being done has moved on quite significantly since our last visit.  I can’t honestly say that I was disturbed by the noise which I found minimally distracting – thank goodness it is not a hotel in the UK – then we’d have pneumatic drills to contend with!!  I did look into this with the other guests and none of them found the noise intrusive, including the Virgin rep who spent time in various areas of the hotel to gauge the noise level.  I know I’m going on about this but there has to be a fair comment on this – everyone is entitled to their opinion after all!  Rooms: we
title: Good value for a budget stay, friendly staff, great pools.
Some initial issues with our room but a great stay overall.

review: I come to Mombasa on business - and due to location this hotel fits my needs. The South Coast of Mombasa are where all the new and posh hotels are situated, with magnificent un-spoilt beaches. As for The north coast, where this hotel is situated, is the older part of Mombasa - and not a lot of attention or development is taking place.   Needless to say, they were renovating with my last stay, which shows they are investing in the hotel. The staff are really friendly - and go out of their way to be of assistance. The rooms are a bit old, but clean. Don't expect too much from the bathrooms - not new but very clean.   The Spa is magnificent, and very reasonably priced. $40 for a 60m full body, which I can honestly say was amazing, with the view of the ocean while being pampered.
title: Rer Khalif Hoilday

review: All fantastic really - touts on the beach are manageable and it is a truly beautiful beach.  Activities around the hotel were fab and the tropical smoothies for breakfast a real hit.  If there were problems they were quickly solved.  Main hate was the fairly dreadful live music over dinner - really could have done without that.  And why were the most comfortable outside seating reserved for smokers?
title: Great summer escape

review: We had read some of the recent less positive reviews about Sarova prior to our trip and wondered if they were about the same hotel. They probably say more about the holiday makers than the resort. A fantastic venue with incredibly helpful staff across the board. Very family friendly with good kids activities. Refurbishment unobtrusive and nearly finished! resulting in pleasant modern accommodation. Water sports good and staff lovely if you ignore the owner. A highlight has to be the switching on of xmas lights party.......
title: Great family trip

review: I stayed with a colleague for a week and there is not much to fault this hotel.  The staff are superb, understanding, beaming with smiles everytime they see you.  Food and Beverage department is an asset to this hotel because not only did we receive great service, the staff especially old Geoffrey, Martha (one without the glasses), Katana, Susan (one with glasses) and the rest were absolutely incredible, in general all staff were superb.  This proves a lot to the management team they have, as it looks like they are being looked after compared to the other hotels I have visited in the area.  I could recognise most of the faces, I think they enjoy working there.  The hotel offers plenty of entertaining activities, we were not bored at all on the 6 nights, Coco Bar is a great place
title: Fantastic Holiday

review: The experience at Sarova White-sands to say the least is amazing, the setting is spacious gives you a lot of options. if with friends and family, you can do alot of activities together and independently. That was the most amazing and astounding features that i love about Whitesands hotel.
title: Excellent Friendly hotel

review: 2 nights at the hotel seemed to be too short to enjoy all the excellent options that the  hotel had to offer! 5 interconnected pools kept the kids occupied during the low tide. The lunch and dinner buffets had great selections and there was even live music with dinner :) The beach bar with Karaoke had great ambience. However, if you are ordering in other restaurants, be prepared for a long wait. By now, having stayed at two other Sarova properties, I had taken the friendly & courteous staff for granted, as for the service.  We had "Palm" rooms overlooking the pools. The rooms were great but the bathroom was in dire need of renovation. The notice board says that they were starting renovations but that would start with the "Sea-view" rooms first. So, for those of us who can't
title: Great Atmosphere!

review: We went to Sarova Whitesands in July 2012 qand had four rooms. The hotel was clean, well staffed by very courteous staff. Rooms were clean. Food was excellent. we had a very enjoyable time.
title: Holiday in Kenya

review: We have just returned from a 10 day holiday Mombassa Kenya. I have to say the hotel was superb and they could not do enough for you any problems were dealt with immediately . The food was buffet style for all meals and had a great selection for each meal and the chef was happy to help if you had a special request. all in all I would be happy to recommend for anyone to choose this hotel We had a ground floor room which was great as the patio doors led out to the three pools Everyone was friendly and very helpfull
title: Easy choice!

review: Easily my top choice for the Mombasa region. Great rooms, food & general atmosphere! Awesome pools - all 5 & interconnected! The beach is alright (too many beach boys). Close enough to Nyali malls if required. Didn't leave once in 4 days .. It's that good!
title: Great Staff, Lovely hotel, perfect Honeymoon!!

review: Our family of 6, including four 20.30's somethings stayed in 3 rooms at this beautiful lush resort from Dec.11 to 14, 2012. It is a huge resort on a white sandy beach on the Indian Ocean with a marine park at one's beckon call. We booked the hotel van from the airport which was waiting for us with hot towels and bottled water!!  There are many amenities including a pool for adults and a bar in the pool as well as two onsite diving and snorkeling concessions. There is also a spa and an area for children's activities. There were also many water toys for younger children. The pool attendants offered large soft towels that were a real treat; however, they seemed to run out often. They kept close track of the towels by room number which became somewhat of a problem when some in our
title: Great resort for a family getaway from Nairobi

review: The services of the hotel is unmatched , excellent services right from the dinning, fabulous morning breakfirst, welcoming letter meet you as you enter the room with sportless orange and sweet banana.  Let me give credit where it's due, the rooms are well kept with spackiling white covers.  Excellent work, keep it up
title: Excellent resort

review: Was here for business and really appreciated the extra few days I had here. The resort is excellent, the service is awesome. Enjoyed the food and amenities of this resort. The spa offers an excellent relaxation massage. The staff here are very accommodating and offer the best service I have encountered in Kenya. The pools are great and the scenery along the ocean are just amazing!
title: Old School Beach Resort

review: Spent 5 days here recently. Overall great experience. It's like being at the "dirty dancing" old school beach resort..but on the beautiful Indian Ocean. Great dining hall with a fantastic buffet every day.  It becomes a bit repetitious but still a great experience. Keep an eye out for the guy who keeps the monkeys & birds away..entertaining in itself! Rooms were clean, high ceiling & good size.Mosquito nets available for night..use them! Resort grounds were fantastic with multiple pools, well kept laws, water falls etc. Literally on the powder sugar sands of the Indian Ocean..but most days it did not feel overly safe to walk down the beach without being constantly bothered by some one trying to sell you something. There was plenty of security on site which tells another whole
title: Fabulous

review: We stayed in Whitesand november 2012. We are coming there 2 times a year for many years. WHY ?????   Because of the very friendly, lovely services. Great Hotel and excellent food. Lovely animation team. They are very professional. At the Cocos Bar is every night entertainment and good music. You dont want to sleep when you stay at Sarova Whitesands because you enjoy every minute. Thanks to EVERYONE for the lovely time again. We come back !!!!!!!  Sylvia and Joana from Holland.
title: Fantastic Holiday

review: We stayed at Whitesands for most of November this year (2012), we received excellent polite,helpful service at all times, including when we had a problem with checking into a pre - booked ground floor sea view room for an elderly parent with mobility problems.This problem was sorted out with efficient actions taken by the manager.
