I would strongly recomend going for the sea view rooms, they are delightful and have recently been refurbished to a high standard, the construction work is on going and will be for some considerable time but if you book rooms up at the spa end of the hotel you will not be inconvienenced too much. An added benefit at this end is the pool area is designated as a quiete area, bliss.  The food at all of the restaurants was very good, no problems with
title: Excellent holiday

review: Having read the most recent reports I have to admit I was a bit dubious about going here having had such a fantastic time in Zanzibar in 2010.  I can only say that we had a nothing short of fabulous experience at Sarova Whitesands.  From the minute we checked in we were met by the most wonderful friendly and helpful staff.  Our room was a twin 1114 which yes was a little shabby but was perfectly serviceable and very convenient for one of the pools - in fact we had sunbeds right outside the patio door.  My only complaint would be that the mosquito net really needed replacing as there were several large holes in it which meant I got bitten at night!  Twin rooms have yet to be refurbished   The food in the restaurant was plentiful and authentic which made a nice change from the
title: Amazing!

review: We stayed at Sarova Whitsands from 31st of december until 6th of January. It's our third trip on the coast and I would not reccomend this hotel. Much better attitude, friendly staff and diverse activities at the Voyager Mombasa or in Malindi Coconut.  First we book and paid on the internet for a standard room. I didn't expect to have different quality in room amneties being a 5 star hotel. The differnce in prices consists in the view. Or it should have. Anyway seeing the reviews here I asked if our reserved standard room is renovated. The answer from the hotel agent, via email, was that only sea view were renovated so we changed reservations for a price that first was 50 usd/ day afterwards changed to 60 usd/ day. And these prices were also different from internet rate.
title: Poor quality service. Not a good 5 star hotel

review: We arrived at 1230 on the 3rd of January after an 8 hour drive from Nairobi. They concierge was ready and helped us with the bags immediately, they however did not provide us with towels or fresh juice immediately.  The checking in process took over an hour. The member of staff who served us was unwelcoming, did not maintain eye contact and was brusque. We were only offered the refreshment towels and fresh juice after asking when we saw other visitors being provided some. The triple room was not ready when we arrived despite having booked a triple room and a double.  When we finally got to the room,we found ourselves in the non renovated section of the hotel. The toilet bowl was brown at the bottom which showed that it was overdue a deep clean. The cupboard had a missing door
title: The golden ice cubes

review: I have stayed at Whitesands in 1999. It was perfect. Unfortunately this hotel has changed, not for the better. I found the room not so clean. The balcony was dirty, both floor and walls. The baseboards in the bathroom had not been washed for months. With very few exceptions staff were not very friendly. There was a leak in the corridor that has not been fixed for our entire stay (5 days). On the first day of our arrival we called room service and asked for some ice cubes. We were told that we had to buy a bag of ice cubes worth 600 KHS and, in addition, pay 500 KHS for room service. So we got a big bucket of ice cubes - whereas we only wanted a few- for 1100 KSH. They have a very nice restaurant close to the swimming pool and next to the beach. Though it is in the open air one
title: value for money at whitesands

review: Excellent weather, far from the airport though; Good customer service clean beaches. During Low peak season lovely get away for the family
title: Whitesands Coast

review: Sarova Whitesands hotel is so amazing. Me and my family came here for a vacation and we have enjoy holiday in here. The staff is friendly, food is lovely and the rooms are great. We did lot of nice activities and the shows in evening were fantastic. I hope that I can come back soon.
title: Fantastic hotel

review: Stayed here for 13 days in Feb. Firstly the rooms, the bedroom/lounge is very much in the colonial style and the room we stayed in was a seaview room with excellent views however it was a little dated but was clean and comfortable. The bathrooms are somewhat in need of a refurbishment as there are water stains almost everywere i.e. toilet,bath,sink. The hotel grounds and swimming pools are excellent with a very good childrens one. Food is varied and of a high standard with menus rotated on a fortnightly basis which means what you get on a Saturday you done necc esarily get the following Sat. In the evening you are serenaded at dinner by a group again different each night. I would add they support the local disabled people some of the groups are made up of blind people and they
title: COLONIAL STYLE
A great holiday in a very comfortable Hotel

review: Trip Advisor is usually full of whinges,and all you need to know is this a hotel where you are really glad you booked and you got good value and terrific friendly attention from the staff at every level. Relax ...you will get just that. Yes the system for servicing rooms is so complicated/archaic you may well find your room is not done that quickly or something is missing....eg.No tea bags..woe!...but they expect you to ring and ask and someone arrives to put things right within at the most 5 minutes,... and its a big site so that is quick.The room servicing was our only niggle and was always remedied at once when less than perfect (Their premium sea facing rooms are undergoing a total refit.. probably lasting until September...but we had rooms well away from them so no noise
title: Lovely hotel

review: A group of us from the office gathered at Whitesands for a strategic planning retreat. The work was hard and the hours were long, but the excellent facilities, service and ambience made the trip into a holiday.  The welcome is first class, with well trained and friendly staff. Accommodation is word-class and the grounds are well organized for relaxation. The numerous swimming pools just make you want to strip and dive, literally!  Excellent food especially breakfast. On the last day of my stay, (Saturday) they surprised me with a champagne breakfast!  I will definitely be back!!
title: Best working trip

review: I had a wonderful holiday last December 2012 with my daughter who was visiting Kenya. She really enjoyed herself especially the swimming pool and the kids club at minazi restuarant. The food was excellent as she is a fussy eater she ate all her food with the help of the staff members especially Zaituni Juma who reassured me that all will be okay as i had to dine in the pavillion while my daughter was at minazi under her watch. The kids club was fantastic as she made lots of friends and i have promised my daughter that we will be coming back in December 2013. The food and service at the Pavillions was excellent and i had a good time. I will definately recommend my friends who intend to visit mombasa to stay in Sarova
title: wonderful holiday

review: Being repeat guests at  White Sands, every visit gets better and my last visit in December during my honeymoon was excellent.  Reservation: Mr. Joshua was great and ensured that we got an upgrade to the newly renovated rooms.  Check in/Check out Warm and friendly check in and the complimentary hibiscus juice and a cold face towel.  The team was also kind enough to allocate us a room as a waiting bay as we had checked in way too early having landed on the 7am flight. Was allowed a late check out to catch a 2PM flight. Kudos Benard!!  The newly refurbished rooms are well done, very good decor, entertainment menu was great, the scenic view was second to none and the cleanliness of the room was spot on.  Food/Restaurants The food was well done too and the service at the Pavillion
title: Splendid Honeymoon

review: Very good food! Enjoy. Service good. Rooms good but a bit dated but new rooms looking amazing. No complaints about our stay. Evening entertainment could be better. Drinks prices were reasonable. I would stay again. Public beach is not so great but was clean. The snorkelling organised by the hotel was reasonable and amazing.
title: Pavilions - Exemplary Service

review: We stayed 3 nights at the end of a 2 week safari throughout Kenya and Tanzania.  We checked in only to be given 2 very old dilapidated rooms which were not what we expected. We decided to speak with somebody the next day about the rooms.  We met with the hotel manager the following day and he listened to our concerns, tool notes and addressed our concerns. He made the situation right by moving us to the newer rooms which were definitely 5 star rooms and very well appointed!  The manager went out of his way to ensure our satisfaction and went above and beyond our expectations to see to our complete satisfaction.   We celebrated our 25th anniversary and were honoured by all staff. Amazing, friendly, happy people work here :)  Thank you Ronnie for a most excellent stay :)  We had a
title: Newly renovated rooms are beautiful but older rooms are terrible!!!

review: Very nice, clean, safe hotel with wonderful food and many nice pools. All staff always smiling with JAMBO, habari!! You really felt welcome there!!! We were a group with 6 people. I, my husband and our grandchild (13yrs) really enjoyed with the others of our group of the visite of one week.  One day we took a taxi to Mombasa and I can really recommend this taxi chaffour for his knowledge and the way of guidning in Mombasa. Call him when you need a safe, good driver. His name is Abuu Nassoro and the hotel will call him when you ask! He belongs to the Sarova Whitesands taxi services. He`s really good!
title: great holiday

review: This was our 5th visit to Whitesands and lived up to our expectations which were VERY high. The refurbishment programme is well underway and the standard of the refurbished rooms is excellent. The grounds, pool and gardens are a joy to experience and it is all that one imagines that a beach hotel could be.   The staff are friendly, courteous and efficient.  Nothing is too much trouble. Our only concern was  the low number of guests - due possibly to the forthcoming elections and some adverse press reports about Kenya generally.   You don't know what you are missing!!
title: First class hotel with first class staff

review: We stayed there last week and took my elderly parents with us.The whole experience from start to finish was excellent,The check in/out process was effiecient,we were greeted by the front office manager Jane who was helpful and very accomadating,she wanted to make sure my eldely parents were looked after even to the extent of customising their menu to suit our requirements.The newly refurbished sea front rooms were excellent,however we opted for the older Palm rooms which were spacious and clean but a little outdated,they were more suitable for my parents as they were closer to the restaurants,bars and other amenities. The Pavilion restaurant was excellent in terms of the selection of food and the quality of service as shown by Geoffrey,Stephan and Christine,they could`nt do
title: Beautiful hotel

review: Very nice hotel.  This is my second visit to Whitesands.  Truly a five star resort.  Staff very friendly and very helpful.  Very relaxed atmosphere.  Plenty of fresh fruit and juices and food to choose from.  Rooms very clean and free use of Internet is very helpful to make life easier when you are abroad.someone is always there in business centre to assist you with wifi and internet  if you are experiencing difficulty.  I got so much assistance from Samuel from business centre and although he is busy still he will come to your aid at any time to make sure you are ok.  Thoroughly recommend anybody.  Jyoti Sachdev from room 2033
title: Best pace to stay in Mombasa

review: They are currently doing a massive room improvement project which means that you sit by the pool and get construction noise all day long. terrible. no peace and quiet  Got severe food poisoning in the restaurant. 5 of us. i was out for 36 hrs. They dont have safe food handling procedures.
title: Noise, construction and food poisoning

review: We have just got back from a 5 night stay following a safari at Sarova Whitesands Beach Resort & Spa. What a wonderful time we had. Wamboi who is on Guest Relations was wonderful and very helpful. We had lots of attention being on our honeymoon with a bottle of red wine, a cake wishing us Happy Honeymoon and on one day a bed full of rose petals and towels in the shape of swans. The hotel was very clean. We didn't take to the main restaurant that well but we absolutley loved the Lido Seafood restaurant. Olivia and her staff Tsofa and Philip were wonderfully welcoming and made the holiday. They were so friendly and bounced off each other so much it was very entertaining. The food at the Lido was amazing with giant prawns on a skewer, fillet steak that was lovely and lobster
title: Fantastic Honeymoon

review: Sarova whitesand is a great place to holiday the staffs warm the hotel is quiet and ambience cool off  them all thestaff are very welcoming  also their to make you feel like you are in the place to be service is excellent and  Good wonderful the have organised events in the evening the I actually take part .like karaoke dancing competition and so in *nd this to me was very relaxing
title: Sarova Whitesands

review: This has to be the nicest beach hotel I have stayed in. The rooms are big and clean, the beds big and comfortable, the view from the seafront rooms is magical, the bathroom big and spacious. The food in buffet form, which generally is boring and repetitive,  is varied and excellent... no absolutely delicious! They even have theme nights. I really can't find a fault in this hotel!   Hats off to the management and the staff that make this hotel a place you just feel good in - wherever you go and all the time! This is a "generous" hotel! They don't cut corners on anything. And the staff, ALL the staff are extraordinary. Have already booked a 10 day stay in May and now going with11 of us!! That says it all
title: A fabulous getaway at the beach and am going back in May!

review: My review with pictures seems to being deleted. It explained how my room was jaded, had mold and was generally in a poor state considering the 150USD a night I paid. This was once a nice resort but not anymore.
title: Reviewing again

review: I have been a regular customer of Sarova Whitesands but each time they always provide me another reason to go back. Indeed a justification that my choice of the resort was well-placed. From arrival the staff made every effort to make my check-in short and smooth. All this great team led by Julius that included Wamboi, Yvonne, Benard, Sarah, Lilian, etc was simply delightfully welcoming. In the course of my stay I got invited to a cocktail with the senior management at which event I met other happy customers with whom we exchanged notes and contacts. A great idea by a great hotel. The profound professional service continued at the restaurant where the team consisting of Martha (the two of them) and the other restaurant staff were plainly superb! The lady who served me my
title: Professional Service with smiles, superb staff
Valentine Wedding in a Romantic Haven...

review: Whatever you do... Don’t go to Whitesands!!! This beautiful peace of paradise is exclusively OURS!! Sarova Whitesands cared for our every need, during the week of our truly blessed, Valentine’s Day, wedding on the beach. The most important person has to be Jessica, our wedding coordinator, a beautiful girl, with a beautiful heart. She exceeded all our expectations, with her attention to detail and every awkward request we had, she enthusiastically delivered. Wamboi, as Jessica’s accomplice, also a true sweetheart, always rushing around with hugs and smiles. Geoffrey, Peter and Elizabeth in the dining hall, who always so cheerfully went out of their way to add an extra special touch, we wish we could take you home with us, to warm our cold country, also Muthoni at reception was
title: Beautiful SAROVA Mombasa

review: What an amazing time we have had and all reasonably priced.  The staff are all wonderful, Charity, Simon, Kennedy, July, Francis, Elias are to name a few.  But there are many more behind the scenes making everything extra special.   The food is excellent and no deli belly.  There is a wonderful spa and Jacob has magic hands and well recommended.   I loved to garden and the plants and a big mention should go to all the gardening team. I would recommend the hotel 100% as nothing was too much trouble for all the staff.  My only disappointment is we weren't notified of the building works by the main pool but there was a nice quiet pool hidden away on the other side of the complex and the forwardness of the prostitues which are tolerated by the hotel staff in the evenings.
title: Amazing hotel and unforgettable holiday

review: My career involves quite a bit of travel, away from home. Whenever I go anywhere I want the comfort of home. Big hotels tend not to offer this and that's why I was wonderfully surprised when I first stayed at Whitesands. The warm friendly atmosphere, good food and lovely service are what have made me continue my relationship with Whitesands whenever I travel to Mombasa. The ambience itself does very ittle to remind you that the hotel is located on the road, but more so in some hidden treasure cove
title: Home away from home

review: I am short of words to describe my experience at the Sarova Whitesands Beach Resort and Spa on the 2nd and 3rd March 2013. I can only wish the stay was longer ..........great facility setting world class standards at the coast and beyond............  Everything from check in to check out was a fresh experience and I truly look forward to come back in the near future. I will be recommending you to many friends for you have set the bar high up with the new room upgrades! The ambiance in the room can hold you there never to walk out during the entire stay. I  watched videos and listened to music from my ipad on the TV screen and that is indeed refreshing. Your quality of bed sheets and towels is excellent, great feel and you only appreciate the beauty of the bathroom when you use
title: 2 Breathtaking Nights at Sarova Whitesands Beach Resort & Spa

review: Whitesands has one of the best breakfast n dinner buffets I have ever had.  Rooms are average, in particular the wardrobes n bathrooms. Room has free cookies which is a bonus  It has 4pools (or more ) which is ideal when the weather is hot. It is located next to yuls which serves amazing italian food
title: Everything is more than excellent!

review: I loved the location and this beautiful property, not too far from the city, yet secluded from the maddening traffic of Mombasa. The beach is right across your balcony, and its pretty much clean and secured. The spa is also nice and clean.   Its fun place for kids as well, as they have a dedicated kids pool with water slides. My two boys were just unstoppable, running all around, jumping in the pool, running on the beaches, building their own castles of sand.   Most of the A-la-carte items and drinks in the bar are fairly priced.   I didn't really like the taste of the food, too bland, non-appealing, and they can really do something about the presentation. Though the staff is courteous in the dinning hall and other restaurant/bar, but when you ask them for a simple bottle of
title: Beautiful property though they really need to do something about their food!!!

review: We stayed at Sarova Whitesands for 10 days and it was by far the most enjoyable holiday I have ever had!  The staff great you with a bountiful smile every time you see them and are always trying to exceed themselves in anyway possible to help you.  On our arrival we were a little early for the check-in time, which involved waiting around in the hotel lobby for 45 minutes. However, after travelling for 20 hours this was not something to worry about as the staff were helpful from the outset and gave us a complimentary upgrade to the sea view room.  The room was perfect, fresh and clean. When Whitesands has finished upgrading the rest of the hotel, nothing else will match it on Bamburi beach for a long time! One qualm that we did have was with the iPod integration with the media
title: Exceptional Service

review: Our first holiday experience in Kenya, and we couldn't have chosen a better place to stay. On our arrival the front desk were very helpful and obliging. We were shown to our seafront room, which is one of the best we have stayed in, with fantastic early morning views and the ocean just a few metres away. All the staff are so friendly, happy and helpful. The restaurants offer a wide variety of food, and once again the staff have been excellent. We have enjoyed the evening entertainment, the bands, and the shows, especially the acrobats who are amazing.  The sea is the warmest we have ever experienced, especially in the afternoon when the tide comes in. We took a trip on the glass bottom boat which included snorkeling and a walk on the reef, we saw plenty of brightly coloured
title: Memorable Holiday

review: I arrived at the hotel on a Sunday afternoon, tired and mentally  preparing for my coming busy week. Wasn't expecting much given this was the season when most hotels undertake renovations and make do with skeleton staff. To my surprise, I received fantastic and exceptional service from the check-in young man by the name Yegon. Usually, I do not do ground floor rooms because I sleep with my windows/ balcony open coz I am allergic to aircon. So obviously, I made a host of requests and all through, Yegon remained calm,courteous, and maintained a genuine smile, concluding the service with...anything for you Ma'am! The Manager on duty, a Mr. Bilal  personally welcomed me to the Hotel. The room was immaculately clean, quiet with a sea view and lots of amenities. If you are flying  and
title: Dissapointed!!

review: I had never stayed at a Sarova until early this year so this was my way of sampling the brand. I must admit, I was very impressed.   To be received by the GM and Front Desk Manager on check in was a pleasant surprise. Patrick & Sarah @ Front desk were pleasant and very helpful.    Rooms: Our ocean facing rooms were very clean and the wing in particular had just undergone a renovation. The views early morning were breathtaking!  Restaurant & Food: The main restaurant was well ventilated and the buffet offered exceptional variety. I loved the Thai themed dinner the most.  Activities: The most appreciated aspect of my stay was the Ozone Kids Club. Gentle and very patient staff took great care of my 7 year old, he couldn’t wait to “report” at the appointed time and every time I
title: Good location and conference facilities

review: Stayed here for a week long conference, the conference facilities are good. There are a many of water sports you can engage including diving, surfing, parasailing and jet skiing. The pools and bars are plentiful and the food is decent. Not a bad place to stay if you have kids or need a venue that can accommodate lots of guests.
title: More Like Stay Away!

review: i loved the stay at sarova white sands mombasa kenya from the time i and my better half got to sarova we were welcomed i just loved the hospitality as i was received like a king and my Mrs as the queen.. it was amazing the whole stay and the most amazing thing about our stay was the manager mr Hersi he welcomed us and sorted the room for us with a lovely chocolate cake and he even went on to arrange for us a complementary dinner at beach side with a music band which was out of this world.. i just loved everything about the entire stay and i and my mrs are longing to go back to sarova for its excellent service and hospitality was just perfect couldn't ask for more.. the new rooms had everything working fine and we had alot of support from the manager and the rest of the staff..
title: Mr and Mrs Arif Mangia honeymoon experience at sarova whitesands mombasa kenya
Oriental bliss at the Tulia Spa

review: I stayed five days at this wonderful hotel in February 2013 and choose the last day before my departure to take a massage - the oriental bliss. I got a full treatment by wonderful Bincy and there are no words to describe this extraordinary experience. The spa itself is a very nice place to relax, hear music and admire the sea view. In a makuti roofed cabin with sea view Bincy gave abhyangham whole body massage followed by an Indian head massage. It was a very subtile, gentle massage, very different from other massages, it felt devine. Afterwards she gave an Indian head massage that was very relaxing, also something I never experienced like that before. Oily over my whole body I was brought to a steam machine where only your head is popping out. Again a wonderful feeling, it is
title: Amazing staff, holiday of a lifetime.

review: I have just got back from a 7 day stay at the Sarova Whitesands. This was my first time in Kenya and I was feeling slightly apprehensive. However, it really did turn out to be the holiday of a lifetime. Has previous reviews have stated; yes they are undergoing renovations, however, this is kept to a minimum and the work is focused on a block at at time. When you sit at the pool bar, yes you can hear banging but not enough to bother you at all. We had our lunch at the pool bar most days and found the food to be fantastic. Our initial room had some small problems, but these were dealt with quickly and efficiently. We were moved to an ocean view room the next day when one became available. The room and view both stunning. We had room 3038.We went on safari which we organised with
title: Sarova White Sands Resort & Spa

review: What a magnificent hotel, location is right on the beach with a beautiful view of the Indian Ocean, food is excellent, pools are terrific, the landscaping is beautiful, the bands in the evening during dinner made for an extremely pleasurable place.  Don't wait....book your reservations and go!!  Staff are so attentive to all your wants and needs, feel like you're VIP!
title: Fantabulous place to stay!!!!

review: Took parents age circa 80+ for first visit to Kenya and wanted a beach holiday, places to walk and a to see a bit of life in Africa however safari not required. Hotel was well spaced out with several bars and seating areas.  Beach good when the tide was in however as is usual in Mombasa, when the tide went out, you could walk for miles. Lovely hotel and staff were amazingly friendly. Hotel arranged for a taxi which tailored a great tour for us but taxi driver wanted to take us to more places and we had to stick with OUR plan
title: Relax, chill & enjoy

review: I stayed at Whitesands on a whim for two days and I really enjoyed myself. While the weather didn't cooperate, the resort still provided a great experience. It's a wonderful mix of Africa and modern convenience. The food was really good (except for the deserts- not worth the calories), the rooms were clean, and the grounds were very expansive. Take advantage of the spa. It was amazing.  Notes:  - The beds are VERY firm. - One of the main buildings is being renovated but the noise and mess are being managed very well. It did not intrude on my experience. It was dead silent until at least 9:00 AM, maybe later. - Prices, compared to Europe and US, are very reasonable.  - White cap beer was my preferred brew. - 2-3 "working ladies" hang around the beach bar at night. They were
title: I like this place!

review: excellent hospitality especially at pavillion restaurant and can't forget asst manager barbara dedication in her work keep it up and nice beach,bar,water sports well maintained overall kenyan's are really good i may visit again kenya with my family and want to enjoy the hospitality of sarova
title: a bit misleading

review: The local made cocktails is an absolute must when watching the band playing some island tune.  May is not the best time to visit with a lot of rain in this period. The restaurant have a big variety of foods for every persons taste bud
title: Pavilion restaurant

review: My brief visit and stay at Whitesands confirmed how great a hotel it is. I had a great time there. The hotel has 3 pools which cater to all sorts, from those who only want to laze about, to those who'd like a bit of diving. There's also a water slide for kids! The hotel has lots of facilities including a spa. Our room was very comfortable and overlooking the ocean though not all their rooms overlook the ocean. The food is slightly expensive but there's variety and there are lots of italian dishes available. The staff are friendly and helpful. All in all we had a lovely time, definitely a great place to holiday and relax and enjoy the sun.
title: Mombasa's finest

review: We just returned from a 14 day stay at the Sarova Whitesands Mombasa - 14th - 28th April.  Having read the reviews about this hotel before we went I was a bit apprehensive. I’m pleased to say that my expectations were exceeded. Even the renovation work was being done in a way that did not affect or disturb our holiday. There was nothing to worry about.  We had a really great time. The room, 2037 with seas view, was modern, clean and comfortable. The food was very good and the menu range had everything and more that we could hope for – too much choice and not ideal if on a diet!!! The hotel staff were fantastic and could not have been more helpful, it did not matter if they were in the waiters, chefs, in the bars, gardeners, pool attendants, room cleaners, the entertainment team,
title: A great holiday at the Sarova Whitesands Hotel

review: Whitesands is still the best if you are looking for good food, good  entertainment, great service and fantastic hospitality!  The quality of the food is amazing. Even though they cook for 100's of people each day and have such a huge variety. Each dish is tasty and well prepared. Whether you are vegetarian or non vegetarian there is something to keep you happy.  The Pizza are comparable to YUL's  though I have to admit I like these more simply because they are crispy!  I love the constant form of entertainment, whether is the  morning water aerobics, the volleybowl or the shows at night! If you have kids this would be a great place to go to because they have a Children's entertainment centre!  The new rooms are very well done though a tad small but whilst you are at the beach
title: Awesome, awesome awesome, luxury and good food

review: The white sand is very famous with its nice beach and lovely white sands.   However unfortunately you can only watch the lovely beach from your chaise long behind the fence. Renovated rooms are well designed, clean and tidy with everything new. Swimming pools and beach bars are nice, restaurants are not bad.  It is a nice resort to have a tranquil vacation at.
title: Renovated

review: We just spent three wonderful nights at the Whitesands resort near Mombasa. We enjoyed a restful stay in this beachside resort that capped a 5 day safari in Kenya's gorgeous interior.  We had stayed at 3 different Sarova resorts on the safari, and the Whitesands offering follows the same winning Sarova formula - wonderful, clean and modern facilities; an exceptionally attentive and professional staff; and varied and bountiful buffet meals offering quality and choice.  They are currently rennovating their rooms and our first night was spent in one of the older rooms at the back of the property.  However, we were moved to a lovely, modern room overlooking the beach for our second and third nights, and the quality of these rennovated rooms is truly superior.  This transition was
title: wonderful beach resort

review: Having spent 5 days on safari I came to this hotel and could not believe my holiday could get any better. From the second I arrived untill the minute I left 8 days later I was treated with kindness and love. All the staff were so welcoming and friendly but that is how Kenyan people are. The hotel was exceptionly clean and even though it is all open plan they employ a young man to frighten the weaver birds away at breakfast it is so entertaining to watch. The food was of top quality and a wide variety to chose from. The views from my seafront room were breathtaking and I sat and watched the sun rise every morning as I did not want to miss a single second of this amazing holiday. I loved it that much that I am going back later in the year and it is the only holiday I have had that
title: Go for it!

review: food was realy great and the variety was wide. the room was basic but clean. customer service was great though we hated the fact that we had to give our room number everytime we went to have our meals...even the 1600 tea. though we understood it was because its a busy hotel, we feel a better way can be found.  the pools were so nice and we loved the fact that we could swim far from the kids...noise! nice stay but not our fave of the sarovas...will we go back? hell yes! partying all night is our thing and whitesands does not dissapoint.
title: PARTY ZONE!!!

review: We stayed for 5 days in Feb 2013. Everything was great from booking until check out. I must compliment excellent customer service by Bevaline in Nairobi booking office, which convinced us to take Sarova offer as we were discussing other options. We did not regret. The place is not 5 star hotel compared to Western standards, but it has an atmosphere. Its greatest asset are in fact their staff who try hard to please guests. The food was excellent, especially for dinner, and I must compliment John, Thomas and Brennah and their Chef for their efforts as indeed they did not repeat anything in five days. Every evening they had different cuisines, such as Italian, African, Oriental, etc. As for breakfast, I would suggest bit more variety of salamis and other fruits such as strawberries
title: Everything was great

review: We came here as a refuge from the horrible Serena and enjoyed every second we spent at this immaculate hotel.   Best service, customer care and luxury hotel along Mombasa's indian ocean and worth every visit.   Thank you whitesands
title: Wonderful experience!

review: Having visited over a dozen hotels in tropical regions around the world, each time choosing a similar location(beach front),status and budget to this, my wife and I rate Whitesands as one of the very best. Our disappointment being so few British visitors. I blame weak marketing by British tour companies who seem to emphasise Safari holidays and suggesting a beach resort as "an add-on". This hotel deserves to be a destination in its own right: wonderful location,lovely staff and excellent facilities.
title: Old rooms update needed!!

review: I can honestly say there is not a single thing about this hotel i disliked!. When we got there at 8 in the morning they had someone to take our bags to our room (only a small thing but i have not had this at most places) The breakfast, lunch and dinner buffets were great and the a la carte was superb. the entertainment was great and the number of pools/beach was amazing
title: paradise

review: Out of season break which included a few days business for my partner who travels there on a regular basis. Overall impression is excellent. Beautiful gardens, well equipped and clean room, very comfortable bed. The restaurant was on the whole, good value. Service was excellent with attentive waiters. Being low season the wine cellar was a little low on stock but there was still a decent choice.   The entertainment was of limited value, on the whole , but provided background to dining. The pools were of varying sizes and one was adult only which provided us some peace from the children. The size of the establishment meant that there was plenty of space for us all.   There were one or two 'working ladies' around the bar at night but they were discreet, just Africa ,really! The
title: Fantastic......by relaxing
My best destination in North Coast

review: I had a fantastic short stay at Sarova Whitesands Beach Resort & Spa. My 4 days holiday was worth it. The customer services from the reception to the pavilion restaurant, coco beach bar and entertainment team was amazing.  The band in the evening during dinner was epic. Good entertainment. I like the idea of the cocktail party  for all the hotel guests every Wednesday evening whereby the guests get an opportunity to meet with different Head of Departments at the hotel and talk about the services offered at the hotel.  Having different theme nights at Coco Beach bar is simply amazing, it made me stick to the hotel every evening.  The pool are terrific and of course the entertainment team, bravo to Japheth & Victor for making my stay memorable. I have learn different games during
title: Best deal ever
Very good holiday in Sarova Whitesands hotel, Mombasa!

review: We stayed here for two nights and was given the beach front room,which was very tastefully furnished,when I opened the glass door  it was heavenly as cud hear  the waves breaking and the breeze and see the sea as far as posbl.The food was good and a lot of variety.Everynight there was something or the other going on and the African dancers were absolutely a delight,tour of the city was well planned.Hotel was very clean and all our requests were promptly attended to,staff was very friendly and spoke good english, a manager was always at hand at meal times,only draw back are the beach boys trying to sell u stuff which the hotel security try to keep clear......but hey what the hell it's part of the holiday experience,.......lots of water sports ,I'd give 5/6 stars to this beautiful
title: An absolutely awesome holiday
Good now, undergoing an upgrade, so has to be good in future.

review: The location is stunning.  The facilities are great.  The first room we were taken to was occupied, but soon rectified with some prompting.  There are busy pools, quiet pools, spa, gym, beach is fabulous.  The main buffet style restaurant ranged from o.k. to good, although having to keep asking for warm plates is tedious.  They did change the style every night so was never boring, and quite a lot of choice. The days by the pool were accompanied by banging, sawing, drilling, but hey, they're upgrading and if the three rooms we had (first one small, main one excellent, last one only for a shower and a bit tatty), then not before time.  Outside everyone is very friendly although they do try to sell you anything.  Best advice is to smile, crack a joke (you'd have to pay ME to get on
title: Never experianced so much friendlyness before on any place...

review: We stayed in this hotel during a round trip in Kenya and Tanzania for 4 nights. The all over experiance was just phantastic. Ourselfs working in the tourism sector never experienced any hotel with such a wide friendlyness of ALL staff. Every single staff was so friendly and helpfull. Anyway in my opinion this hotel deserves 5 stars instead of 4.  The new renovateds rooms were very clean, wide and spacious. We had a room with balcony with top view over the beach. As well I am very delighted about the all over attidute of staff (management?) about animals. There are a few, very clean cats in the garden area of the hotel and they seem to be well accepted, what is a great achievment in my eyes, as they keep the hotel clean and save from bugs and mice!!! We had a stay with breakfast
title: Nice resort

review: Myself and four friends stayed at the Hotel for three nights during the last week of June 2013 (As part of a total two week trip, including a Safari tour in Masai Mara, and staying with friends in Nairobi) It was a short stay at the Sarova Whitesands, but a fantastic one - I could happily have stayed forever!   The staff were friendly, accommodating and polite. The facilities in the hotel were impressive, the decor and gardens were beautiful and the rooms were equally so. We were particularly impressed with the food, fantastic variety and quality….and we quickly developed an obsession for the delicious fruit smoothie cocktails by the pool!   We also took part in a few of the water activities- snorkeling was a highlight for me. The staff were very keen to ensure we were taken
title: Only disappointment was not staying longer
worst service ever for young travellers

review: we were a huge group of teens who went to relive stress after finishing our exams. from check in the assistant male manager rolled out a face since we were a huge group and we were staying at the hotel for 8 nights. he seemed that he would be having to go through a lot of pain. we all disliked him from there. we also had to sign policies which was not mentioned to us. we did not even receive a complimentary welcome drink from travelling 7 hours in a bus till we had to ask for one. at times the desserts in the pavilion had bees which was very disgusting and even when we told the waiters the did not bother to change it. the security guards in the hotel gave us a curfew. and chased us to our rooms in the middle of the night. this is soo useless as no one has rights to send us to
title: Amazing Honeymoon Holiday
Great location ruined by extremely poor service

review: We stayed here for our Honeymoon at the end of June and had a fantastic time. All the staff were amazing, and so so polite. They are always going out of their way to ensure you are ok etc. We had a beach front room and it was excellent. The hotel is currently being refurbished...which was a shame but it didnt disturb us that much. It should be complete by end of September in time for high season. We did lots of the activities that were on offer to include volleyball, beach walks, archery, tennis, table-tennis, yoga and aqua aerobics. All this was lead by the animation team who were fab! The food was outstanding, and the sheer variety was brilliant. We ate like kings for 12 days!  I would also like to make a special mention to our friends in the Amimation Team - Victor, David and
title: Sensational Sarova

review: Honestly the staff at whitesands are just putting their best. I Got to learn a few salsa dance steps.  The rooms are well done. You may want to fix  the leaking tap room 3088.  Pavillion food is classic.
title: Salsa dance

review: Though currently the "product" is undergoing an upgrade, my visit in early April 2013 still enabled me experience the best service at the coast. Great reception from Patrick, live band in Thursday evening, the usual birthday band (though I think they need to eat a lot more Lemmon) and the ambiance.  Breakfast is my best as usual while at Whitesands with the freshness of everything. A good team lead by Barbara is just the best!  Will be there in May for sure.
title: Getting even better

review: For excellent service, look no further than Whitesands. not to forget the sumptuous cuisines offered. The view overlooking the ocean is spectacular, both during the day and at night.  Good work, keep it up
title: Excellent Service

review: Once again, I find myself safely wrapped in the comfort and happiness that Sarova Whitesands brings with every trip I make.  I visited alone this time, with some anxiety for many different reasons, however, I had no need to worry.  I can't put into words how wonderful the whole staff at Whitesands has been to me.  I had my every need catered for, I was never left alone, constantly escorted when I needed "bodyguards" to take me for cash etc.  The whole experience has completely confirmed how very caring this family is.    Now, to turn attention to the ongoing refurbishments.  Yes, there are extensive refurbs happening at this hotel.  However, I certainly did not find it intrusive or unduly noisy during my stay and most of the time i was at the Lido pool where most of the
title: Changes for the Good and the Better

review: checked in on 12 july with wife and two sons( gentlemen)...for four nights.Staff were simply great and very friendly.Breakfast was awesome and fabulous with variety of fresh fruit and plenty to sample from the hot buffet.Dinners were equally lovely with different cuisine outlays to choose from.Our Sea view rooms were kept very clean, and changed frequently to guarantee enough towels and amenities.The Entertainment team was in top gear and kept everyone involved in various programmes happening.The pools were clean and staff available to assist when required.will definately repeat a visit,and tell my friends about  visiting Whitesands,                                                               Chef D Muriuki, Belfast.
title: holiday for a life time

review: An excellent hotel where I visit again and again.  My son's favourite ever since he was born, thirteen years ago.  Cannot count the number of times we have been there.  Never disappointed ever!!!.Great for kids of all ages.  Superb staff and very good management. Just love the place.
title: The Perfect heaven for beach lovers.

review: We were very pleased with everything about this hotel.   From the moment we arrived we were particuarly impressed with the level of customer service. After a long hot journey it was nice to be greeted with cold towels and a check-in process that was completed whilst sitting by an ornamental pond with a cold beer!  The room had recently been refurbished to a high standard and was kept spotlessly clean throughout our stay. The entertainment system was high-tech with USB/HDMI access so we could play our mp3 music in the room speakers and view our photos/videos on the TV.   The food was of a very high quality, particularly in the Lido restaurant - I would recommend the lobster curry served in a coconut shell. The Minazi was also very good with a wide selection. We only used the main
title: Excellent

review: I was on an extended business trip in Kenya and stayed over 3 weeks at the Sarova Whitesands Hotel in Mombasa.   This was my 3rd visit and I feel a bit guilty for the delay in posting this review.   I must congratulate the hotel for the excellent & hospitable staff  be it the Front Office, the Restaurants, the Business Centre, the Housekeeping, Laundry and the security.   In all sectors, the staff are very well trained, motivated and in fact self-motivated to keep the guests well served.  I must say that it is the hospitality and attitude of the staff that makes be want to return to the hotel. I am also looking forward to revisiting Kenya in the future with my full family and I will make sure to stay at this hotel.  While I compliment the hotel, I would also like to say some
title: Outstanding hotel with beautiful grounds and excellent service

review: We recently satyed in this hotel for our honeymoon after our Safari. The service here was great and we had a wonderful room looking over the ocean. The range of pools available was nice so if we wanted a quieter afternoon we could use the silent pool. I had a great pamper one day in the spa over looking the ocean and it was all very relaxing. Another day we went on the glass bottom boat and went snorkelling - our guide here was great and pointed out all sorts of fish including lion fish, trumpet fish and sting rays, it was truely amazing! Overall we had a great stay and will look to return again in the future.
title: Great for a honeymoon

review: First class, First rate, Staff never stop smiling and are so friendly. I am staying here at the moment and will definitely return. The Manazi Italian restaurant is superb the food is outstanding and the staff is so attentive where Zaituni is as good a waitress as I have ever had.
title: One of the best hotel resorts I have stayed in.

review: Have always enjoyed my stays at the hotel whether for business or pleasure. Was recently there for a much needed break and couldn't be happier. The Swift check in, friendly staff, homely room, good food and serene surroundings all contributed to a relaxing weekend. Phased renovations are ongoing and was pleased to get a room with upgraded facilities. The one downside all weekend was a half hour wait for service at the Lido's poolside bar...other than this, all was well and would definitely recommend a stay here.
title: Superb

review: I have visited Sarova Whitesands Mombasa several times and still remains a favourite every time I visit Mombasa. I always promise myself to try other properties (which I have years back) but this one takes the cake. A year ago we visited the hotel in a group (Two families) and the service was just great.The rooms are beautiful with all sort of views  and best of all if you have kids they have a kiddie kind of thing so as to let the parents enjoy their time at the Coast. Proximity to the city is good, and to the malls even better. Their entertainment is good as well - though they need to have some music at the pool bar (one of my favourite spots). Great customer service across the hotel. The meals are just to die for, what I love most about it is the wide variety, you may stay
title: One of the Best if not the Best

review: The new rooms are great - go for the sea front rooms for a great view.  Service and food great and pools really fun for the children - especially the water slide.  The water activities are fun also - try the banana boat.
title: Relaxing by the beach

review: I have stayed at Whitesands more times than I care to remember[ I tell a lie.Thirteen times] Each time on a two week holiday.....What you get with Whitesands,is a beautiful colonial type hotel,with old fashioned values...The grounds are supurb and a joy to walk through....The hotel food  improves on each visit,and is of a very good standard.......The beachfront Spa is one of the best that I have experienced[I am lucky to get away to two or three different holiday destinations each year]............Also, the recently refurbished rooms are first rate........But......the magic of Whitesands ,is plainly and simply the staff..A wonderful attitude,combined with warmth and humour...Can't wait for my next visit,to see my friends....Brooker.
title: The very best...........

review: I had a great Stay here. The food is great especially the breakfast. The staff were very helpful and very warm. Joshua (I was not able to meet him though) one of the team members in the management was ready for my hard questions via email.  The rooms are big and clean. I loved the complimentary tray. I didn't expect it  They have WI-FI but I was not able to connect to it on several occasions. I hope the next time I shall be there, I will be able to connect  Always looking forward to your breakfast
title: Great Place

review: We stayed at this hotel following our 7 day Somak Cheetah Safari. Im not sure if the reason I disliked this hotel so much was because the accommodation on our Somak Safari had been so luxurious and definately 5 Star.  This hotel was not in the same class as the accommodation we had just had for 7 nights. I had chosen this hotel as I wanted to be sure of luxury, comfort and good service as I was hoping to have some R & R after the Safari but unfortunately this was not the case.    Firstly the hotel is in the middle of very extensive renovations and I was not aware of this before I got there. The whole of the middle section of the accommodation was being renovated while we were there which almost divided the hotel into 2 separate areas. To walk from one side of the hotel to the
title: Not for me!

review: Absolutely amazing the accommodation was immaculate the food was excellent and varied the staff were extremely friendly professional and efficient.  II would just like to make the point that the resort is in the process of updating their rooms and witnessed first hand the lengths the resort went to to keep this to a minimum. They have to do this work at some point and unlike some reviews on here we didn't complian we used our legs to find plenty of spots that were quiet as you would want on your honeymoon. I don't write these reviews very often and will take some of them with a pinch of salt after hearing next to me the facts then reading a complete exaggeration on this site from clearly the same person  Thank you for reading my review and I hope it provides a more accurate
title: Words fail me all we could wish for on our honeymoon

review: I checked in yesterday after a 10 day safari trip and longed for a relaxing holiday in the whitesands. However, when I entered my room and I surprisingly found that the room was so old and dirty. There were ants near the toilet paper rack and even on the toilets roll.  The water was brown in color. I washed my swimming suits with the water from shower and it made it turn brown too. I asked to change another room and the staff told us that the hotel was full. I was so disappointed to this so called 5 star hotel for this kind of room is supposed not to be rented out. This room is the worst among the several hotels and lodges I stayed in Kenya.
title: Noise

review: I spent a month at Sarova Whitesands in Kenya including Christmas and New Years eve. Was a great party however must admit that i have many problems with noise . I asked many times to change the room and even in a quiet area ( Spa) i had issues. I haven't seen proper approach from the staff as I think they are unprepared. Besides that this is a nice hotel for kids and family.
title: Hotel review

review: White sands is probably the best hotel in the north coast of Mombasa and located in the prime place of tourism.  Spread in a large area  with as many rooms , conference facility and a place to chill out in any season with their spa and swimming pool. The food spread is quite nice and caters to vegetarian clients too .   The entrance and the lobby is very attractive.
title: Super hospitality.....real professionalism.....wonderful stay

review: We stayed here in June, so perhaps the renovations are well on the way and it has improved since then. However, I was not impressed with our room at all. I must say though that we were definitely not placed in the renovated area, as some of the other rooms we saw looked good. We had not booked the hotel ourselves, but were part of a group. It may be worth checking where you are staying as I couldn't believe that the bathroom tiles and toilet seat had been re-painted instead of being replaced. How much does a toilet seat cost? I thought the room appeared dirty and I personally would not return purely for the state of the room in which we stayed. On the positive side, the communal areas were nice and the food was ok
title: Average

review: We stayed at Whitesands for 4 nights in mid-July. The service was impeccable! Philip the server in the seafood restaurant was amazing! He was so personable, kind and accommodating. The food was also delicious, worth the extra expense. The entertainment was fun and for all ages. I would recommend staying in the remodelled rooms, as ours was outdated and the AC didn't work well. A tip for men you must wear pants for dinner in all restaurants! If we return to Kenya we would absolutely stay here again!
title: Great Way to End an Awesome trip!

review: The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Little touches like noticing what your favorite breakfast tea and ensuring it is at your table just improve the overall experience.  The new rooms are beautifully done but I have to admit I will always be a fan of the older ones
title: Wonderful stay

review: I came back after few years to this excellent hotel but his time for a small conference!  Renovation is well done and the place has a face lift, unfortunate I miss my family when I learned that they have children program and playground and the couples entertainment every night! I enjoyed my stay...of course the staff were professional but I was amazed of the great food and fresh fruits everyday at that scale! I can't wait to bring the family here for a small vacation!
title: Flexible for conference,honey money,vacation! You can't beat Sarova!

review: what an amazing hotel.    we stayed for 3 days in mid august.   the entire staff was wonderful.  everyone there is so friendly as you walk through the grounds.   they have remodeled many of the rooms making the stay so nice.  I had booked a garden room but we were upgraded to an ocean view at no extra cost.  we had a half board deal meaning buffet breakfast and dinner was included each day.  that makes the place extremely affordable.  one hint to save money, try to skip the a la carte lunch which can get expensive.  the night time entertainment at the beach bar is fun as well.   we were invited to a cocktail party with hotel management one night.  they asked if we had any concerns.  I asked them about the A/C in our room which went out during a power glitch.   it was fixed
title: amazing experience

review: Excellent hotel with newly renovated rooms right on the beach. All you can eat breakfast and dinner while serenaded by a local band. Exciting cultural entertainment in the evening at the Coco Bar. However, I have been in communication with hotel staff and management to fix an over billing issue which occurred during my recent stay in May. To date there is very little resolution with only partial payment. It has been a very frustrating four month experience trying to recover payment that was made when the reservation was made and also again at check out. The bottom line is that I was billed twice but the staff seems unable to comprehend this even though I provided the proof. My recent emails to staff have gone unanswered which I consider completely unprofessional. Please pay
title: Double billing

review: My (now) husband and I stayed at Sarova Whitesands for two weeks in August for our wedding and honeymoon. From the moment we arrived we had 5* service. We arrived around 8am in the morning after a long night flight, we were told by Hayes and Jarvis that check in was at 12 and we managed to get into our room by 8.30am (they even sent 3 different members of staff to come and find us to tell us it was ready as we went for a wander around the hotel).  The room was lovely, we paid for a sea view room and we were really impressed with the view. The room was beautiful, the bed was HUGE and the shower was amazing. I now want to buy a superkingsize bed and an overhead shower. We were kind of annoyed that we paid for a seaview room when it seems that lots of people had been upgraded for
title: Excellent though the Sparkle is missing

review: My family and I will always love this place this being our fourth visit since last year,this time we did 5nights.The ambiance was awesome as usual and we got to stay in the newly refurbished rooms which I was really dying to see!We had two rooms and both were so nice overall!The food was scrumptious as usual and even though no much variety as much as the themes suggest,we still ate to our fill. The only thing that was missing was the 'SPARKLE'. Staff at whitesands are always friendly and all smiley but this time something was somewhat a miss.As much as I really do not expect plastic smiles as we are human but even staff that had seen us previously on holiday were not looking enthusiastic and all I can say is that we love you guys but please don't ever loose the magic touch,you
title: Gorgeous property

review: I would like to state from the on set that i have enjoyed my stay at Sarova White Sands since my arrival in this beultiful hotel. On behalf of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and International trade of the Republic of Kenya and on my own behalf i  would like to appreciate the services rendered by the entire staff of the Hotel to the just concluded Summit of Infrastrucure. I would like to single the following who went out of their way to ensure that the 2nd Infrastructure Summit is a success story.I really appreciate the Commitment and dedication to duty shown by the following members of staff 1.Mike Kamau F&B 2.Jayne Kiragu of front office 3.Halima of Business centre 4.Innocent of guest relations 5 Phildlorah  of Businness centre     I personnally look forward to coming back and
title: 22nd to 29th August 2013

review: Maybe our 5th time return visit. The renovations are great and now the rooms are modern. However management should rethink how best to manage visitors. This week they are hosting politicians and they decided to ignore and treat other guests as if they were not welcome, blocked parking spaces, pool area, kids play room and gardens towards Lido. They shouldn't  have taken in other (us) guests and should have asked the government to block the whole hotel.  They should learn from peers who took this route and are now begging for business and really run down. This is a business not a government entity and all guests deserve  to be comfortable  and free to move around without harassment.  Short term marketing tactics i.e be seen on media with so and so can ruin a brand name, which you
title: Waow

review: The customer service is excellent and the hotel has variety of food to choose from including sea food that i had never imagined or even thought of eating. The kids corner was amazing with variety of activities that ensured the kids were happy and enjopyed their stay in the hotel. we had earlier planned to go to other sites but on reaching the hotel we cancelled all the plans as the kids were engaged through out and their "teachers" were excellent. Donald and Barbara in pavilion had also an excellent perfomance not to forget the guy who was filling the bar every day just to ensure we had enough drinks. Note: the bar contains soft drinks as well and for those of us whom we do not drink, we requested him to put aside alcoholic drinks and we had a good time there.
title: Almost perfect

review: Our Travel agent had booked this resort for us for two nights!  As we arrived this place looked very nice gleaming Place. Once we checked in. we were escorted to our room.  Soon as i walked in to our room< I walked straight out and very dissapointed. told the porter that we're are not staying on this property! Our Room was very out dated and smelled of musty mold, and  a very long walk from the main building/ lobby area, and felt very dark and unsafe on that part of the block of rooms. Nevetheless. The General manager was very proactive caring  and moved us  near the main building, and appointed us a newly renovated suite with a beach view . This met our expectations, we had no complaints and slept happly ever after. The breakfast & Dinner was great. We skipped the lunch since
title: Second Room

review: 7/10/2013   My husband and I have just returned from 2 weeks holiday at this brilliant hotel.  This is our 2nd visit to them and we would return to them EVERY time !!!!   The food is fabulous - we had no problems with the fish/salads (as we are often told to avoid these when travelling).  There was a vast choice of menu every day both at the main restaurant and the other two on site.  We chose Full Board which included food from a choice of restaurants and all our drinks (except for some spirits).  The whole holiday was very good value for money.   We couldn't resist going to Coco's bar in the afternoon for our cup of tea and pancakes !!!!!  All the staff are extremely helpful and go out of their way to solve any problems/issues that you might have (we had a problem with a
title: Honeymoon

review: My Bride and i stayed here 31st till 3rd of October making use of the Honeymoon package.From the moment we arrived and where greeted by Yvonne we were made to feel special. All the staff were warm and friendly and we found the room clean and comfortable.As part of our deal we were treated to a complimentary spa treatment which was excellent as was our complimentary 3 Course meal served to us by Susan at the Lido Restaurant.Guest Relations were good as Yvonne who was tasked to look after us went that extra yard to make sure our trip was unforgettable and it will always be.We would also like to thank Donald and his staff for making us welcome.We found it all excellent value for money and have no hesitation in recommending to one and all. Mr & Mrs Davies
title: Mombasa

review: We've stayed here on two occasions now. We are familiar with Kenya as our son lives there. Facilities are excellent, with clean rooms, three good pools, and reasonably near to the City; 15 mins in a cab. There is a good shopping centre ( Nacumet) 4 mins. In a cab. In the Nacumet, there is a coffee/Bistro of first class. Best to eat out and there are many good local restaurants as the hotel food is, typical of Kenya, basic.
title: Good location

review: My husband and I traveled to Mombasa for our 15 year wedding anniversary and had the pleasure of staying at the Whitesands Beach and Resort. From the moment we stepped into the resort, we were treated like royalty. The staff were amazing! As the staff carried our bags to our room, we were delighted at the beauty that surrounded this resort. We were pleasantly surprised to learn that we had received an ocean front room. The breeze from the ocean, mixed with the sound of the surf and the beautifully decorated room made me think I had died and gone to heaven! Our meals and service were top notch~actually, I don't think I've ever met more accommodating and kinder people. My husband and I could not of been happier with our stay. One of the highlights for me was the monkeys that
title: Beautiful Experience

review: Am sitting at the airport right now already missing staying at White Sands. It was a magical experience with good food, friendly and helpful staff. The Tulia Spa is lovely and the honeymoon suite was beautifully decorated to welcome us. It's a fantastic hotel for everyone
title: Wonderful Relaxing Holiday

review: We have just arrived home after a week safari followed by a relaxing week at the Sarova Whitesands. The hotel is lovely, the staff are extremely pleasant and really can't do enough for you, and we had a very relaxing week. We had a package booked with kuoni which included standard rooms, however when we checked in we were given two sea view rooms which were newly refurbished - they really were lovely rooms and we were very grateful for the upgrade. The hotel is in the process of refurbishing the rooms, and so I didn't see the rooms not yet refurbished. Our room was on the quieter side of the hotel near the quiet pool and spa, and we spent a lot of time lazing on the beach lawns on the sun beds in that area. You currently cannot see or hear refurbishment in that area at all and
title: Best holiday ever

review: The most terrible hotel I have been to.Let me start with the ambience!The place has not been maintained at all!!You could even see the tiles everywhere have been worn out as they been used for years and years...the same goes to the bathroom. NEEDS a major repairs!!!The restaurants are filthy with spider webs!!!Food is OK.To top it all there was no water the next day!!!For the whole day!!!!This property needs to be refurbished. .
title: WARNING!!!DON'T COME HERE

review: As a family we visit Whitesands at least twice a year for Holidays. My boys only know Whitesands as Mombasa. We have attempted to stay at other hotels including Voyager, Mombasa Serene but my younger one will ask "why are we not going to Mombasa" meaning why are we not at Whitesands. For me it even gets more specific. Whitesands is Elizabeth Mutuku. One phone call to Elizabeth and our holiday begins with a beautiful welcoming voice on the other side of the phone.   The epitome of my best Elizabeth (Whitesands) experience was this summer (4th August - 7th August). We were meant to check out on the 7th of August mid morning only to find out the airport was on fire. I rushed to the front desk to extend my stay, in light of not knowing how we were going to fly back. The Hotel was
title: Home away from home

review: I stayed at Whitesands for ten days and whilst there my fiance and I were married.  We chose to take the resorts wedding package which quite simply did not disappoint us one bit!  This place oozes luxury from the minute you arrive.  The staff can not do enough for you, of not was our very own Guest Relations representative 'Angela' who weeks away from us arriving was in contact to ensure everything we wanted was catered for fully.  During our stay we were even upgraded to a suite which was pure luxury.  The standard of the 'normal' rooms are excellent having been recently refurbished.  Whilst there we stayed on a half board package and to be honest breakfast and dinner were enough, the standard of food is excellent and there is a great deal of choice.  My new wife and I enjoyed
title: Great experience

review: Hi All, I know Kenya well, but this was my first trip to Whitesands as an all inclusive holidaymaker. Overall the stay here was excellent, but marred by a few weak areas. I was in a refurbished room and it was superb, as was room services. The staff overall were good and professional. Unfortunately the overall economic situation is weak for the local staff meaning that wages are simply not covering living costs. Tips are not added extras, but are putting essential food on the table. The cost of food and housing have soared over the past 6 years and the economy is diving as there are few European tourists compared to pre election violence in 2007. The security was tight around Mombasa and the hotel with high visibility armed police and plenty of hidden security. Attacks by
title: Pretty good but no cigar

review: We spend 4 days at this hotel as part of our honeymoon safari in october 2013 and absolutely loved it! The hotel is clean, great food (many choices and every day different theme for dinner), nice swimming pools and beach and good facilities. The gym is quite large with modern equipment and there is a very active entertainment team, not only for the children but also for adults. We especially enjoyed the activities organized by David and Simon with their excellent volleyball/waterpolo skills and always up for the challenge of a problem-solving-trick.  Staff was very friendly and helpful, which made our stay very relaxing and fun.
title: Brilliant - Brilliant - Brilliant

review: Just returned from a 2-week stay at Sarova with our daughter who is 8, the hotel was perfect, you could not want for a better hotel. The rooms was fantastic just been re-furbished and a sea view, 4 or 5 swimming pools, one has a kids area an other organised events such as volley ball or water polo, but if you didnt want to join in you were left alone.  Main restaurant is buffet with lots of choice, also a Pizza an Pasta restaurant and Sea food by the beach which you have free access to.  The fun A team were brilliant keeping people entertained, especially at night at Coco's beach bar, special thanks to Victor, David, Steven, William and Crazy David.  All the staff were friendly and could not do enough for you. You tend to sit in the same area of the restaurant and have the same
title: Another great visit!

review: My husband and I are both Police Sergeants in California, U.S.A.  We had very little concerns for our security during our Safari but had concern during our stay at Whitesands due to the threat by Al-Shaabab who reside in Mombasa as well as bordering Somalia (property plans for both Serena and Whitesands were found during a search warrant of a residence harboring Al-Shabaab).  Upon our arrival at Whitesands, two young security personnel were stopping individuals to search their bags and use a metal wand to ensure no weapons.  Several people failed to stop and walked past both security officers who seemed oblivious.  At one point, the security officer said, "Wait" in a very low voice with no command presence.  He appeared as if he wanted to stop him, walked a few steps, and then
title: Untrained security personnel and food service staff lacking in social skills was disappointing
A really great place to stay.

review: We have visited this place twice over the past six years. It hasn't changed much at all in that period. All the staff are excellent from the check in to the check out and beyond. The chefs are to be congratulated. We shall visit again soon.
title: "A Wonderful Week At Whitesands!"

review: My Wife and I have just returned from Masai Mara/Mombasa....our first visit to Kenya....our best holiday ever! After 6 days of 06.00 starts and 7+ hrs on daily Game Drives we were looking forward to a relaxing week.....Sarova Whitesands Resort and Spa was just perfect!! It is the biggest hotel in the area, on Bamburi Beach, North of Mombasa...approx 45 mins from the Airport....depending on the traffic!! First thing to impress is high level of security on the gate, and in the hotel entrance. Guards are very visible within the hotel, in the gardens and along the beach-front. We felt very safe throughout our stay! Reception was excellent....a welcome drink, then registration was quick and easy. The hotel was quiet during our stay, so my request for a 17.00 check-out was no problem.
title: Tremendous hotel with excellent staff

review: It was indeed a great weekend i had in White Sands. The Location was awesome, the beach, a big  swimming pool with bar in between. The Tulia Spa was memorable experience. Night life was worth mentioning, the dim lights bar on the shores of the beach. Quite place to enjoy the beach sports and lot more. People were friendly, especially the drivers and bell boys.
title: Nice Resort to Stay

review: I spent a night at Sarova Whitesands and was thrilled by the spacious rooms,  fast internet speeds and the ambience of the hotel set up. We enjoyed the evening in the beach and hopefully I'll return next year. The only problem is that you lose Internet connection as soon as you check out which is unreasonable especially if you intend to leave the hotel abit late having checked out.
title: Sarova Whitesands

review: whitesands....great staff...attention to detail...great rooms...ma favourite place was the coos beach bar...awesome beach view...the dawa coctailk...really is the medicine..da breakfast...so great..woke me up really good...live cooking station for waffles..room service took ages to arrive...
title: cocos beach bar...magnificent

review: I stayed for 2 days on business. Beautiful tropical gardens, lovely buildings. Rooms are modern & comfortable, big shower, no bath. No iron. Gowns + the usual stuff. Food is fresh, good quality buffet. The spa is on the beach and very affordable ! The grounds are spacious and well maintained. Make sure you visit Yul's, a wonderfull beach reastaurant a short walk along the beach.
title: Affordable paradise

review: Sarova whitesands is the place to stay. the staff are very welcoming, couteous, very respective to their clients. the rooms are spacious and fresh, not to mention the beckon to get the nice breeze from the ocean. if you enjoy swiming no clouding very many pools for excellent and amateurs.wonderful teams to help one exercise in a very very wonderful way.
title: A  nice place to stay and enjoy holidy

review: This is one place you get value for your money, great staff and in matched hospitality. Food so delicious and the location by the beach of Indian Ocean will take your breath away literally!! It's close to the Mombasa downtown and near public transport if you want the real experience and cost cut!! Sales guy called Gift and a chef by name Ambrose will make your stay one of the most amazing experience in your life. It's way too much fun!!
title: Breathtaking

review: I had a great stay with my family. spacious rooms, good staff and good food. Thanks to Joshua and Hilda for taking my hard questions and facilitating my accommodation. I love this place with all my heart and i will come back. My children have urged me to let them stay here forever. Brought tears to my eyes. Thanks.
title: Great Hotel

review: We stayed here for one night in november,for one night on our way to malindi. This hotel is excellent and was sorry we had only one night,we arrived late at night But we're checked in and showed to our room with no issues and were given a cool drink and hot towel to freshen up, we were tired and hungry and we were told we could avail of the restaurant, Which was open 24 hrs , I fancied a cup of tea. With some fries and my husband had chicken and chips, it was delicious and was plenty for two people, our room was beautiful which looked out over the ocean, it was spotless clean and so comfortable. We slept so soundly  With just the sound of the ocean. Breakfast was a buffet which was excellent, the staff were friendly and efficient.but don't forget guys ,give employer of the month
title: Whitesand hotel

review: spent two glorious days here while holidaying in Kenya. before and after our safari. right on the Beach as well. all we had to do was go down a few steps and walk along the beautiful white sands and dip our feet into the warm waters of the indian ocean. the hotel caters for all types, adults as well as kids.the hotel is protected by security so felt very safe at night .room was good, food in resteraunt differed every evening. different theme each night. only set back was it says no sports shorts or shorts. wouldn't let me in resteraunt at first because I had 3/4 lengths  on. I was a bit annoyed as these were neither shorts or sport shorts. all the staff very polite and always seemed to be happy. chatted to one of the bar staff who was very friendly and polite her name was susan .
title: Lovely place to be

review: We stayed at the Sarova Whitesands Hotel for a week of relaxation and to celebrate a birthday and I have nothing but good things to say. The hotel, whilst completing the last of its renovation works, was nothing short of excellent.  Superb rooms (we had a sea view room and were literally 20 steps from the beach) with all the facilities you would expect from a luxury hotel.  The staff were friendly and attentive - each one of them had time to wish you a good morning, good afternoon, how your day has been and even chat a little during breakfast, lunch or dinner.    I had read reviews about this hotel before travelling to Mombasa and was a little bit worried about those that mentioned that the renovations somewhat dampened their experience but I can happily say that this was not
title: Amazing, Relaxing Experience

review: Our stay was sooo relaxing and refreshing, just what we needed.  The good side about this hotel is the super friendliness of the staff.They are amazing.Also the greenery and serenity is very peaceful.There is so much variety for the buffet meals you cant miss something you like.There is a kids playground equipped with swings and all.Definitely a plus.The hotel is right at the beach so its convenient for early morning and night walks.  The only negative thing i had was with our room.Its an old wing and upon entry it smells dump and murky.The pool view though from the balcony compensated a bit for it.However that wing would do well with refurbishment.  Would definitely visit again .
title: 5* Luxury - Bamburi, Kenya

review: I actually stayed here in Jan/Feb a few years ago for what was a originally planned two week vacation.  Wanting to experience East Africa as a tourist for the first time but unsure as to where to book led me to the conclusion that some 5* luxury once in a while isn't a bad thing, hence staying here.  This hotel complex is just great, once you arrive...
